loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza tiene 41 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba un medio de vida para mantener a su hijo que está a su cargo, Maria no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar  lamentablemente sus padres no tenían suficiente dinero pero le enseñaron las cosas más necesarias, por medio de una amiga que le dio la idea de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, fue así que decide obtener esta fuente de ingresos. Su deseo es que su hija finalice sus estudios, para que sea una gran profesional. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, pan, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
41-year old Maria Esperanza has been running a small store for the last three years. She needs the income from it to support her child. Sadly Maria did not have the opportunity to go to school as her parents could not afford it. However, they taught her the most important things. A friend gave Maria the idea of opening a store in her home; this was how she decided to earn her living this way. Her wish is for her daughter to complete her education so that she can get a good job. The loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, oil, candy, bread, juices, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock for store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts (peanuts) and simsim (sesame seed) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell. Rose is 31 years old and is married to a nurse. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Simon Bolivar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco de Emprendimiento esta Compuesto por 8 Integrantes, todos viven en la misma zona del km 14 en los siguientes barrios Simon Bolivar, Balcon 1, Barrio la Floresta  en la gran mayoria de los integrantes trabajan en el area de comercio como ser venta de productos de primera necesidad, albañil, bombera en pigas, cajera, peluquera y fotocopiadora, transporte, punto viva, trabajan en la zona del km 14 ,centro 1er anillo,santa cruz,urubo condominio las palmas. 

La Presidenta es la Sra. Veronica, casada ella tiene una tiendita d ebarrio donde vende productos de primera nenecidad, el dinero del credito lo utilizaran en la compra de productos para surtir su tienda, ella es muy trabajadora, responsable, por su solidaridad con sus compañeras fue elegida presidenta del banco de emprendimiento, esta casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte urbano, los dos trabajan para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida de toda su familia. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras ya que este banco es nuevo pero tienen el deseo de ser el mejor banco y llegar a obtener el mayor monto que otorga emprender los socios estan muy agradecidos por haber confiado en ellos ,
texts.en:
This Banco de Emprendimiento is composed of 8 members, all of whom reside within the vicinity of 14 kilometers in the following neighborhoods, Simon Bolivar, Balcon 1, and Barrio la Floresta. The majority of the members work in the commercial sector, such as a vendor of basic necessities, construction worker, firewoman, cashier, hairdresser, fotocopier, transport, and communications. They work in the area of 14 km, center 1er anillo, of Santa Cruz in the Urubo Condominiums Las Palmas. The President is Ms. Veronica. She is married and has a small store in the neighborhood that sells basic products. She plans to use the money from the loan to purchase more merchandise with which to stock her shop. She is very hardworking and responsible. She was elected president for her solidarity with her colleagues. She is married and has a husband that works in urban transport. Both of them work with the hope of moving ahead and providing a better quality of life for themselves and their family. All of the members are responsible and dedicated and while this bank is new, they have a great desire to be the best bank and achieve the largest amount of credit possible. The members are very grateful for the confidence that has been bestowed upon them.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es: Graciela del Carmen tiene 42 años, se dedica  a la venta y compra de cerdos. Hace más de 5 años tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  Para poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida, ya que además se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a Graciela le gusta conocer diferentes actividades ya que así tiene más oportunidad de enseñarles a sus hijos como ganarse el pan de cada día. Poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar cerdos, ya que en su comarca este negocio es muy rentable, además que ella deposita mucho empeño en su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, pues tiene que pagar para que una persona traslade los cerdos a su vivienda.
texts.en:
42-year old Graciela del Carmen buys and sells pigs. For more than five years she has had her two children to look after. In order to help her family to get ahead and improve their standard of living, she also sells cosmetics. Graciela enjoys learning different activities as in this way she has the opportunity to teach her children how to earn money. Over time she saved enough money to buy pigs since this is a very profitable business in her region. She also puts a lot of effort into her work. She plans to use the loan to buy pigs, and she also has to pay someone to transport them to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock for store

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling home appliances by purchasing sewing machines to sell. She will use the profits to invest in clothing and school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda vive en la casa de su mama y su deseo es tener una casa propia, tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende carne, actividad que aprendió de su mama desde muy joven, Yolanda viaja a las ferias en donde compra los animales.
Yolanda esta ahorrando para los estudios de su hijo, lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de ovino y cerdos.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in her mother's house and it is her wish to have her own house. She is 28 years old and has a 10-year-old son. Yolanda has a stall at the central market of the town of Ayacucho where she sells meat, activity she learned from her mother when very young. Yolanda travels to the markets where she buys the animals.

Yolanda is saving for her son's schooling. What she enjoys the most are the pleasant meetings of her Banco Comunal which distract her a lot. Her loan will be invested in buying sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es el transporte público, hace mas de 2 años adquirió dos vehículos,   y desde entonces recorren las rutas locales, en tanto su esposo es uno de los conductores, quien trabaja arduamente brindando este servicio.  Zenaida considera que esta actividad le es más rentable que la agricultura, ya que era el anterior trabajo que ejercía; aunque no tenga descanso ahora, pero la recompensa al esfuerzo se ve en las ganancias, es por esta razón que desea dar mantenimiento a sus movilidades. Su mayor anhelo es comprar otro vehículo y para ello está ahorrando. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y asegura ser cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas y por tal agradece  a aquellas personas que son gestoras del préstamo, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su movilidad.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 46 and lives with her husband and children in their own home. She works in public transportation. Two years ago she acquired two vehicles, and since then she travels local routes (her husband is one of the drivers), and they work hard to offer this service. Zenaida believes that this activity is more profitable than farming, which was her previous occupation. She never takes a break, but the reward of her work is evident in her earnings, and for this reason she wants to properly maintain her vehicles. Her greatest wish is to buy another vehicle, and she is saving up for it. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she will be punctual with repayments. She is grateful to those who support her loan, and knows it will be very useful in the growth of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Kantutas Del Pedregal Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento KANTUTAS DEL PEDREGAL es una asociacion formada por los vecinos D. la zona del pedregal ubicada a 45 minutos D. la ciudad, es una zona que aun no esta urbanizada por lo que las personas que viven en el lugar en si mayoria son D. escasos recursos y con pequeños negocios, la asociacion cuenta con 11 integrantes quienes ingresan en su primera secuancia D. prestamo. 

Su representante es la Sra Flora elegida como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento, quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa en las distintas zonas D. la ciudad D. La Paz, venD. D. feria en feria,ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al trabajo D. transportista, quien le ayuda a su esposa transportando su mercaderia ambos tiene 3 hijos que aun se encuentran en etapa escolar, la Sra Flora es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora e invertira el prestamo otorgado en la compra D. mercaderia para su negocio y asi mejorar la condicion D. vida D. su familia.

Todas los integrantes D. la asociacion estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
The communal bank KANTUTAS DEL PEDREGAL is an association maD. up of neighbors in the Pedregal region located 45 minutes from the city. It is a region that is not yet urbanized as most of the people that live there are poor and have small businesses. The association has 11 members that are entering their first loan cycle. Their representative is Flora. She was elected president of the communal bank. Traveling from fair to fair, she sells clothing in the different regions of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband who works as a carrier and helps her transport her merchandise. Both have 3 school age children. Flora is a very responsible and hard-working person and will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business and so improve her family's living conditions. All of the members of the association are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Estrella y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones alegres con sus amigas.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos que están estudiando, Mercedes vende verduras en un triciclo de manera ambulatoria por diferentes calles del Distrito de San Juan Bautista, su día se inicia a las 5 de la mañana para ir a comprar al mercado de abastos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de manzanas, platanos, zanahoria, cebolla.
Mercedes sueña con construir su segundo piso y que su hija se titule.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of "Banco Comunal Estrella" and what she likes the most are the joyful meetings with her friends.

Mercedes is married, 43 years old with 3 children who are studying. Mercedes sells vegetables from a tricycle on different streets in the District of San Juan Bautista. Her day starts at 5 o'clock in the morning when she buys her supplies at the market, assisted by her older daughter. Her loan will be invested in buying apples, bananas, carrots, and onions.

It is Mercedes' dream to add a second floor to her house and that her daughter graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apples, bananas, carrots, onions.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen termino de estudiar la carrera de Antropología y actualmente viene realizando los tramites para obtener su Bachiller, Karen es soltera, tiene 25 años y vive con su madre, vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Los sueños de Karen son obtener su titulo e implementar una florería para lo cual esta buscando local.
Karen es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores artificiales.
texts.en:
Karen finished her studies of Anthropology and presently she is processing her batchelor's degree. Karen is single, 25 years old and lives with her mother. She sells cosmetics from catalogs to friends and relatives. It is Karen´s dream to obtain her degree and set up a flower shop for which she is searching for premises.

Karen is a partner of "Banco Comunal Estrella" and requires a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in buying artificial flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase artificial flowers.

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es: Dalia Sonia se dedica a la venta y elaboración de refrescos y golosinas. Hace más de 8 años que dedica a este negocio, además de esto ella imparte clases en una escuela pública a pesar de que no gana mucho se lleva la satisfacción que les enseña a los niños lo necesario. Es por esto que Dalia se esfuerza todos los días por mejorar la actividad económica y así ofrecer más ganancias para su familia. El destino del crédito será para refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas y verduras. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y ofertar nuevos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dalia Sonia sells and makes soft drinks and sweets for a living. She has done this for more than 8 years as well as teaching classes at a public school, and even if she does not make much money it satisfies her to teach the children the necessary knowledge. Therefore Dalia makes a daily effort to improve the economic activity and thus offer more profit for her family. The loan will be spent on natural soft drinks, juices, sodas, candies, fruits and vegetables. It is her dream to improve her business and offer new products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Puka Pukayoq Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Puka Pukayoq”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios, Mercedes es la presidenta, Brigida es la secretaria, Valentina es la tesorera y Paulina es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa D. la señora Valentina que muy amablemente les cedió un espacio D. domicilio.
       
Las actividades económicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. comida y chicha, crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y venta D. hortalizas. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo albañil, empleado D. la municipalidad D. Pachar. 

Mercedes, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad D. Pachar. 

Mercedes nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Puka Pukayoq”  somos 12 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. Su actividad económica principal D. la señora Mercedes es la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella tiene su galpón en la comunidad D. Yanahuara. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 a 30 cuyes, el par D. cuyes compra entre 15 a 20 soles dependiendo D. la raza del animal. Mercedes compra en el mercado D. Urubamba y en el mercado del puente Grau D. la ciudad del Cusco los cuyes.
texts.en:
The Puka Pukayoq community bank has 12 hard-working and enterprising female members, and is currently in its sixth cycle. These women are always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and strive daily to proviD. a better future for their children. The bank is represented by its president, Mercedes; secretary, Brigida; treasurer, Valentina; and auditor, Paulina. The members meet every 30 days in Valentina's home, which she has very happily opened to them. Examples of members' activities incluD. the sale of food and chicha (liquor); raising small animals such as guinea pigs; and vegetable sales. Other members offer services such as bricklaying for the municipality of Pachar. Mercedes is 34, has two children and lives in the Pachar community. She tells us: "In my community bank 'Puka Pukayoq', there are 12 of us and they elected me as a representative to tell you about my activities". She mainly raises small animals such as guinea pigs. Her storehouse is in the Yanahuara community. She has been doing this for two years and it is going very well. Mercedes is requesting this loan to buy 20 to 30 guinea pigs. A pair of guinea pigs costs between 15 and 20 soles depending on the breed. She buys guinea pigs in the Urubamba and puente Grau markets in Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Paola Cecilia

texts.es:
Paola de 21 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vivía en la Sierra del Ecuador con su familia, en ese lugar  es muy común el ornado de chancho con mote y cebollas (plato típico), pero por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que irse a Guayaquil a vivir con su familia. 

Ya viviendo en Guayaquil empezó de nuevo a vender ornado de chancho en su casa, poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de dinero, ahora ella tiene un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa, trabaja con ayuda de su mama desde muy temprano. 

Para que sus clientes estén mas cómodos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, sillas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un criadero de chanchos.
texts.en:
Paola is 21 years old, she lives in an urban zone of "las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She used to live in the mountain range of el Ecuador with her family, there "ornado de chancho", pig with cooked corn and onion (typical dish) is very common, but the lack of opportunities made her move to Guayaquil to live with her family.

Living in Guayaquil she started to sell "ornado de chancho" again from her house, and little by little her capital increased and now she has a small stand outside her house. She works with the support of her mother from very early on.

In order for her customers to be more comfortable, with the loan she wants to buy tables and chairs for ther business. In the future she wishes to set up a pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos que están estudiando, de profesión Bióloga, Maria dejo de ejercer su profesión para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso para su familia. Hace 4 meses ingreso al Banco Comunal y ahora esta ahorrando con el objetivo de implementar su laboratorio. Los sueños de Maria es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean buenos profesionales.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas y para una puerta ya que recientemente culmino con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
40-year old Maria is married and has three children who are students. Maria is a biologist by profession, but she stopped this line of work to bring up her children. In her free time she sells cosmetics to her friends and relatives from a catalog, and in this way she earns money for her family. Four months ago she contacted the Community Bank and is now saving money to start up a laboratory. Her greatest wish is for her children to continue their studies and get good jobs. Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy perfumes, lotions, and a door for her recently-constructed house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and a door

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina M., reside en La ciudad  de San Miguel, tiene 55 años edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y  cuatro nietos, vive con sus cuatro nietos y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. 
Catalina tiene 28 años de hacer tortillas y actualmente sus nieta le ayuda a la elaboración, su negocio fue por iniciativa, es honesta, responsable,su trabajo le ha servido para solventar las necesidades de su familia, ella comercializa las tortillas  casa de su hermana en un horario de 5: 00 am – 2:00 pm,  sus clientes son vecinos y amistades que circulan por el lugar.  
 Catalina necesita el préstamo para comprar al mayoreo y a un precio más bajo (Maíz, cal, leña, gas), ella necita invertir $200.00 en la compra de maíz, y el resto para leña y gas, este dinero le ayudara a continuar trabajando y apoyar a sus nietos para que sigan con sus estudios, ya que es la principal fuentes de ingreso de la familia, 
Las aspiraciones Catalina son que con el préstamo  generar  ingresos, tener más ventas de tortillas, y ahorrar un poco para iniciar pronto la construcción de su casa, ya que actualmente solo cuentan con el terreno, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
55-year old Catalina M. lives in the town of San Miguel. She is a single mother with two children and four grandchildren with whom she lives. She has been making and selling corn tortillas for 28 years, and these days her granddaughter helps her. She started the business through her own initiative. Catalina is an honest and responsible woman. Her job has enabled her to provide the basic necessities for her family. She sells the tortillas in her sister’s house from 5am to 2pm to her customers--neighbours and friends who are passing by. Catalina is seeking a loan to buy goods (corn, lime, firewood, gas) at wholesale prices which are lower. She needs $200 to buy corn and the rest is for firewood and gas. This money will help her continue with her job and also support her grandchildren so they can stay in school--her earnings are the principal source of income for the family. Catalina hopes that the loan will generate more income through increased sales of tortillas. She also hopes to save a little so they can begin construction of a house soon (at the moment they only have the land), and to improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, gas

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, es casada, tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y están estudiando. Delia tiene tierras de donde cultiva tara y cochinilla, también compra de los productores, luego de acopiar los vende a un intermediario que va a su comunidad. Además Delia los días domingos vende comida en el estadio de su comunidad, actividad que realiza con ayuda de sus hijos.  
Delia pertenece a Finca hace 15 años, los prestamos le ayudaron en el crecimiento de su negocio y ahora solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cochinilla.
Delia esta un poco mal de salud y desea superar su enfermedad para seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Delia lives in the community of Huayllapampa which is located 30 minutes from the town of Ayacucho. She is married and has five children, two of whom live with her and attend school. Delia grows tara (a Peruvian plant) and cochinilla (an insect for making red dye that lives on the prickly pear cactus). She also buys from other producers and stockpiles the products before selling them to a buyer who comes to the community. In addition, on Sundays Delia sells food in the community stadium with help from her children. Delia has worked with Kiva partner Finca for 15 years. The loans have helped her expand her business. Now she is seeking a loan of 1200 soles to buy more cochinilla. At the moment she is not too well but wants to get better so that she can continue working and helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cochinilla

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos P., reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa del Departamento de Usulután, tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposa  tiene 50 años, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera.
Carlos aprendió el oficio hace 22 años, y a base de esfuerzo y sacrificios logro comprar las herramienta necesarias para tener  su propio taller de carpintería en la casa de habitación, el elabora camas, roperos, jugueteras, sillas y mesas de madera. Trabaja según la demanda de sus clientes para maximizar los materiales. Con los ingresos de su trabajo él ha solventado las necesidades de su familia. 
Carlos es un señor muy trabajador y responsable quien realiza un excelente trabajo, así mismo es muy cordial y amigable. Él solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de materiales para elaboración de muebles  y comprar diferentes clases de madera, pegamento, clavos, pintura, barniz, esto le ayudara  para tener a la venta muebles, atraer  clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio, el aspira tener un taller grande, diversidad de muebles terminados, obtener ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos P., lives in the municipality of Jucuapa in the Department of Usulután. He is 61 years old, and he lives with his 50 year old wife. He makes wooden furniture for a living. Carlos learned to make furniture 22 years ago, and due to his hard work and sacrifice he has managed to buy the necessary tools to run his own carpentry shop at his house. He makes wooden beds, wardrobes, toyboxes, chairs, and tables. He works according to the demand of his clients in order to maximize his materials. He uses his business's profits to pay for his family's necessities. Carlos is a very hardworking and responsible man who does excellent work, and is also very kind and friendly. He requests a loan to buy furniture making materials such as different kinds of wood, glue, nails, paint, and varnish. These materials will help him to have furniture for sale, attract clients, and provide better service. He aspires to have a large shop with many finished pieces of furniture, and to make more money to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cedar wood, glue, nails, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Cristo Vive 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Cristo Vive (Christ Lives), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with long-term partner and their three children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fish balls from the kitchen of her home by purchasing more fish. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children. Her long-term goals are to save enough money for a car and her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase fish to make fish balls

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mana está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ella es  Karla Janett B. coordinadora del grupo quien  inicio con la venta de refresco y luego con las ganancias y los prestamos invirtió en productos para formar su modesta venta.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Susana María A. se dedica a realizar tortilla y vende frijoles cosidos y crudos hace un año y cuatro meses,  Nelly del Socorro Palacio Berroteran tiene una pulpería y Estela Antonia Z. S. empezo comercializando jocotes y pinolillo en la actualidad vende ropa y calzado.Ellas invertiran los creditos en sus negocios 
para que este cresca.
texts.en:
The group "Mana" is made up of 4 hardworking women. One of them is Karla Janett B., who is the coordinator of the group. She started out selling soft drinks, and later with the earnings and some loans she invested in products to set up her small store. Her fellow group members are Susana María A., who has made tortillas and sold cooked and raw beans for a year and 4 months. Nelly del Socorro Palacio Berroteran has a grocery store and Estela Antonia Z. S. started out selling plums and pinolillo (a drink made of cocoa and toasted corn), and currently sells clothing and shoes. They will invest the loans in their businesses to make them grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Evelyn Vanessa posee un negocio de venta de mercadería en general como cosméticos perfumes y ropa de manera ambulante, tiene 31 años de edad  es madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo. Evelyn sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, pues a pesar de que todos los días son muy difíciles nunca se da por vencida siempre está pendiente de que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día, ya que ella  es muy responsable. El financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisas, trajes y ropa interior. Su deseo es salir adelante cada día.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn Vanessa runs a traveling sales business in which she sells general merchandise such as cosmetics, perfume, and clothes. She is 31, and is the mother of two children who are able to go to school thanks to her hard work. Evelyn goes out everyday to sell her products on her bicycle which is her only mode of transportation. Even though her days are very difficult she never gives up because she is responsible, and knows that she can't let her children go hungry. The loan is for the purchase of pants, skirts, shirts, suits, and underwear. Her wish is to keep moving forward everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene 37 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una  casa alquilada. Hace mas de 5 años que ofrece el servicio de transporte público, asimismo es vendedor de productos naturales, que previamente se ha capacitado como medico naturista de su zona, desde entonces recomienda con la seguridad y garantía de sus éstos productos naturales. Desde entonces y durante las mañanas trabaja en el servicio de transporte y durante las tardes se dedica en la venta de medicina natural. Ambos negocios le son importantes y rentables y por tal razón deseo adquirir a futuro su propio terreno y tener  su espacio de ventas y otra movilidad mas. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura cumplir con sus pagos además considera que este aporte le será importante y de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de llantas para su carro.
texts.en:
37-year old Marco lives with his two children in a rented house. He has worked in public transportation for more than five years, and as well he sells natural products. He has taken training as a naturopath in his area. Now he can safely recommend and guarantee these products. During the mornings he works as a driver and during the afternoons he sells natural medicines. Both jobs are important to him and bring in a good income. For this reason he wishes to obtain a piece of land of his own so he has space for sales and more vehicles. This is Marco’s fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP and he promises to complete all his repayments. He believes that this financial support is important and will be a great help for his business. He will use the money to buy tires for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios; Erika Maritza es la presidenta, Florencia es la secretaria, Jeannete es la tesorera y Deivis es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Collana del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento de Cusco. 
       
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de comestibles, venta de anticuchos, elaboración de bordados y estandartes, venta de chicha, cerveza y gaseosas, venta de comida, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Otros socios brindan servicio de taxi y sastrería. 

Remigia, tiene 47 años, tiene seis hijos y vive en la comunidad de Collana. 

Remigia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”  somos 13 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Su actividad económica principal de la señora Mercedes es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella tiene un pequeño corral donde tiene 75 cuyes y varias gallinas que se encuentra en su domicilio. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es la agricultura, ella alquila un terreno para sembrar papa, maíz y otros productos más. Remigia requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales como por ejemplo forraje y también va comprar pollitos para criar.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Collana community bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. It is made up of hardworking and enterprising people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life, and to provide their children with a brighter future by working hard every day. The following people are members of the community bank: Erika Maritza is the president, Florencia is the secretary, Jeannete is the treasurer and Deivis is the auditor. The members get together every month in the community of Collana, San Jerónimo district, in Cusco department. Members have jobs in different fields. For example, some sell food, some sell anticuchos (Peruvian kebab); others do embroidery or make banners. Some sell chicha (drink made from corn), beer, and soft drinks; others raise animals such as chickens or guinea pigs. Some members drive a taxi or are seamstresses. 47-year old Remiga has six children and lives in the community of Collana. She tells us: “In the Santa Rosa de Collana community bank, there are thirteen of us. They chose me as their representative to give information about my work." Her main job is raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has a small pen in her house in which she keeps 75 guinea pigs and several chickens. She’s had this business for two years and it’s doing well. Remiga also does some farming. She rents a piece of land and grows potatoes, corn, and other produce. Remiga needs a loan to buy food such as fodder for the animals and also young chickens to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal food

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrellitas está integrado por tres feminas trabajadoras una de ella es Lorena Gutiérrez Lara, coordinadora del grupo quien desde 2007  vende ropa usada, frijoles y frutas en sus casa. Lara tiene cuatro hijos de edades 14, 11, 9, 5 y 3 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan en el negocio.

 Sus compañeras de grupo son  Ileana Z. Chavarría es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cinco años y  Ruth C. C. tiene una pequeña venta y comercializa calzado.
texts.en:
The Estrellitas (Stars) group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Lorena Gutiérrez Lara, the group coordinator. Lorena has been selling secondhand clothing, beans, and fruit from her house since 2007. Her children are aged 14, 11, 9, 5, and 3. They are students and also help her with the business. The other members of the group are Ileana Z. Chavarría who has run a small general store for five years, and Ruth C. C. who has a stall selling shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, beans, vegetables

loans.name: Maria Isabe

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 31 años, su actividad es crianza y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella dio inicio a esta actividad por que su esposo tiene una pequeña finca en donde tiene un sin número de animales, por lo que él le dio la idea de obtener este rubro, así Maria empezó a dedicarse completamente a esta actividad, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos y alimentos que son necesarios para la alimentación de los mismos. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 31, and she has been raising and selling pigs for over three years. She got the idea to do this kind of work because her husband has a small farm where he keeps any number of animals, and she has been doing this work full time ever since because she has always liked working. She now requests a loan to buy pigs and feed for them. She dreams of being able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pea seeds

loans.name: Sueños De Emprendedores Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sueños de los Emprendedores” and this is the second time it has a loan published on Kiva. The members of this group are from the city of Temuco. They are involved in dessert-making, sewing, running a book store, a general store, and selling chocolates, household materials, clothing and undergarments, fruit and flowers.

The group member for this interview was Elizabeth, who is the group’s treasurer. In the photo she is in the front row, on the left, in a green sweater, holding the hand of one of her associate’s sons. She runs a general store out of her home where she sells fruit, basic household goods, and other items. She runs the business on her own.

Elizabeth will invest this loan in more merchandise (sugar, rice, pasta, detergent, and shampoo), and in firewood and coal, which will be needed in this region in southern Chile for the cold winter. Because these are needed products, this will be a good business. Her dream is to increase the variety of merchandise in her store.

Elizabeth’s greatest motivation is her 13 year-old daughter; she wants to give her everything she needs for her basic and advanced studies so that she can secure a solid economic future for herself.

What Elizabeth has liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza has been the opportunity the organization has given her to move forward, without putting up obstacles to her ability to access credit. Additionally, the good treatment she has received in the entrepreneur training and educational workshops, has made her feel valued and important.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile’s indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: Assorted merchandise, charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jazmín está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas una de ellas es  Gissel Idania C. quien inicio vendiendo ropa usada y nos cuantos cosmeticos actualmente se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y reacargas Claro, empresa telefonica.

 Sus compañeras de grupo son  Gessella C. Rodríguez  quien realiza  recargas tanto movistar y claro y vende carne y pollo, mientras Elia Espinosa S. en su casa de  habitación vende refrescos, verduras y frijoles. Ellas invertiran el credito en negocios con lo que espera que mejoren.
texts.en:
The Jazmín group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising, and dedicated women. One of them is Gissel Idania C.. She started out by selling used clothes and some cosmetics. She currently sells Avon products and calling cards for the Claro telephone company. Gessella C. Rodríguez is her colleague in the group. She sells Claro and Movistar calling cards. She also sells meat and chicken. Her other colleague is Elia Espinosa S.. She sells soft drinks, vegetables, and beans in her house. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses, which they hope to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Avon products and calling cards

loans.name: Jose Abedon

texts.es: El señor José tiene 36 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El señor José tiene una unidad de moto taxi, la cual circula en toda el área urbana desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche. El ya tiene 7 años de tener negocio, cabe señalar que el la compro con el objetivo de suplir sus necesidades económicas dado que la situación del país esta difícil y no podía conseguir empleo. Ahora en día, el trabaja como chofer de la moto taxi y puede brindar la manutención a su familia. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar unos repuestos para la unidad, con el objetivo de brindarle mayor presentación a la misma. Sueña que sus hijos pequeños puedan prepararse en la universidad producto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose is 36, is married, and has two small children. Jose has a motocar taxi, which circulates through the urban area from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. He has been running this business for the past 7 years, which he bought in order to be able to take care of his family because the situation in his country is difficult and he couldn't find a job. Now he cdrives the motocar taxi and he can provide for his family. He is requesting this loan to buy some parts for his taxi so as to improve its appearance. He dreams of being able to send his children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy taxi parts.

loans.name: Gaudy Hazel

texts.es: La señora Gaudy Hazel tiene 27 años, es casada. La señora tiene en su casa de habitación una pulpería, la cual está muy surtida. Ella  tiene 4 años de tener este negocio, este negocio dio inicio con pocas cosas, como golosinas, frutas, etc. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole y este ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a tener la pulpería muy surtida. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de realizar una inversión considerable a su negocio antes que se acerque la fecha del 30 de mayo, en que se espera las ventas de todos los productos se incrementen por ser el día de las Madres. Su sueño es seguir incrementando y haciendo crecer su negocio, y si es posible llegar a tener una distribuidora en el mercado.
texts.en:
Gaudy Hazel is 27 years old and is married. She has a small grocery store in her house, which is very well stocked. She has had this business for 4 years; she started out with only a few items, such as snacks, fruit, etc. Over time she was investing in the business, and this made it grow little by little until it became a well-stocked grocery store. She requests this loan because she wants to make a substantial investment in her business before the 30th of May, when she hopes that the sale of all items will increase because of Mother's Day. Her dream is to continue to make her business grow, and if possible, to become a distributor in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marimba

texts.fr: Madame Marimba D. est une femme  commerçante qui habite dans le quartier de Daroukhane  à Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye laye depuis mai 2006. Elle est mariée  sans enfants. Son activité  est orientée vers l’achat et la vente de produits venant du Mali et de la Cote d’Ivoire tels que savons, karité, etc. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion,  aussi  elle  ne  voulait pas rester inactive. Ce qui fait son fort c’est que c’est une activité  qui marche toujours car ses produits sont sollicites tout le temps. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de passer une nouvelle commande de produits et ainsi renforcer son stock et en même  temps son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marimba D. is a merchant who lives in the Daroukhane district in Guediawaye. She has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2006. She is married but has no children. Her business involves buying and reselling products coming from Mali and Cote d’Ivoire such as soap, karité (shea butter), etc. She is passionate about this business, and of course she did not want to remain idle. Her great strength is that the business is successful since the products she sells are always in demand. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to allow her to put in a new order for products and thus bolster her inventory and her sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: La Sra Modesta  es cliente antigua D. Emprender, trabajo a partir del año 2001 con un grupo solidario "Urkupiña", ella se edica a la venta D. leche, tiene vacas que cria y orD.ña diariamente llevando cerca D. 15 y 20 litros por día, y reparte por la zona D. Chasquipampa y otras zonas aledañas, ahora solicita este crédito para la comra D. forraje y adelanto para la compra D. otra vaca, ella vive en la zona D. Pedregal, en casa popia, es una cliente muy puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, tambien responsable y trabajadora, se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años, antes vendia por mayor la leche a una empresa D. la ciudad D. la Paz, pero vio que era mejor ir vendiendo casa por casa ya que asi obtiene mas ganancia. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion D. los creditos.
texts.en:
Modesta is a long-standing client of Emprender; since 2001 she has been a member of a communal bank called "Urkupiña." She is a dairy farmer; she has cows that she raises and milks daily producing between 15 and 20 liters of milk a day. She distributes it around Chasquipampa and other neighboring areas. She is asking for a loan now to buy forage and for a down payment on another cow. She lives in her own house in the Pedregal area. She’s very punctual with her repayments and also is very responsible and hard-working. She’s been in this line of work for several years. Prior to this, she sold the milk at wholesale to a large milk processing plant in La Paz but she learned that she could earn higher profits selling directly door-to-door. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy forage.

loans.name: El Campanario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Campanario está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Jesica Zeledon, coordinadora del grupo quien desde hace tres años puso un pequeño caramanchel en su casa donde vende ropa nueva y usada. 
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Antonia N. quien vende frijoles cosidos y queso y Giovanna M. desde hace seis años comercializa productos avon.
texts.en:
The Campanario Group is made up of three hard-working people. The Group's co-ordinator is Jesica Zeledon. Three years ago she erected an awning outside her house where she sells new and second-hand clothes. Her companions in the group are Antonia N., who sells beans and cheese, and Giovanna M., who has been selling Avon products for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don José  es un hombre trabajador, trabaja por turnos y abecés todo el día como recamarero, lleva varios años en esta labor, es padre de un hijo
Y su anhelo es lograr terminar su casa, su esposa trabaja de lavado y planchado para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar pues todo ha incrementado. Con el financiamiento anterior logro terminar un cuarto, aun falta repellar las paredes, pintar, embaldosar, y lo que hará  a primera instancia es el cambio del techo de su casa ya que esta en malas condiciones y le es de gran necesidad poder hacer esta mejoras.

Sus planes es poder trabajar a tiempo completo para poder obtener ingresos altos y de esta manera ahorrar para poder hacer sus proyectos en su casa a largo plazo.Hasta ahora esta sastifecho por los logros ya que es de pocos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working man. He works shifts - and sometimes double shifts - as a cleaner. He has been doing this for several years, and he has one son. His wife takes in laundry and ironing to help with household expenses, which have gone up recently. José's greatest wish is to finish his house. With an earlier loan, he finished building a room. He now needs to plaster the walls, paint, and tile the floor. What he will do first, however, is change the roof, which is in a poor condition and really needs improvement. His plan for the long term is to be able to work full time and earn more, so he can save up to complete his home improvements. He is pleased with what he has achieved up to now on his limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, solder, and other roofing materials for his home

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.en:
Carlitos F. was born in Zambezia province 36 years ago. He attended secondary school till the 12th grade and started university. The last part of his studies was undertaken after he joined the military. He lives with his partner (she is the one in the photo) and has five children with her, aged 16, 15, 12, 7 and 3. They all go to school and need support. He also has one younger brother under his responsibility.

Carlitos moved from his original Zambezia province to the Maputo area for work reasons – he got sent to teach in a military school in Catembe, right across the Maputo bay. He has done this job for the last two years.

Carlitos is asking for a loan to buy cement to upgrade the house where he lives with his family, to make it more habitable. He hopes that he can provide his family with a suitable home with the help of Kiva lenders. He came to request the loan in person but he was at work when we had the chance to visit his construction to take the picture, so his life partner is posing in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement to upgrade his house

loans.name: Felix Bayardo

texts.es: Félix Bayardo tiene la actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más 10 de años que tiene este negocio, pero al pasar el tiempo el decide ser comerciante minorista para que le den un puesto en el mercado cuando le dieron el puesto Poco a poco ha incrementado los víveres en su negocio, con granos y otros productos. Pues siempre le ha preocupado su hijo que no le falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, verduras, jugos, gaseosas, detergentes, jabones y productos variados. Sueña con mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Félix Bayardo has a small grocery store. He has had this business for more than 10 years, but as time passed he decided to become a retail merchant so he obtained a stall in the market. After they gave him the stall he started gradually increasing the products in his business with grains and other items. He has always been concerned that his son would lack for nothing. The loan he requests is to buy staple grains, snacks, fruit drinks, vegetables, juices, soft drinks, detergents, soaps and a variety of other products. He dreams of maintaining an active business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy groceries

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando M. was born in Tete province, Changala district, and he is 40 years old. He studied till 9th grade so far and is currently attempting 10th grade. He lives with his partner (she is in the photo) and has four children with her, aged 14, 12, 8 and 4, all going to school.

They moved from Tete to Maputo because of Fernando’s work in the army. He has been in the army since 1980 and is presently serving as a battalion chief in the Catembe base across the bay from Maputo, the capital of Mozambique.

This is Fernando’s fourth loan with Hluvuku, Kiva's partner in Mozambique. He intends to by blocks and bars to carry out the constructions in his house. He hopes he can upgrade his home and provide his family with a suitable place to live. He is confident he will be able to repay with his regular income as a soldier.

Fernando came to request the loan in person but he was at work when we had the chance to visit his construction site  to take the photo, so his life partner is posing in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy blocks and bars for house construction

loans.name: Ndeye Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Anta S.  est une femme de 52 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Cite Ndiobene dans la localité de Baye laye dans la banlieue de Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis janvier 2010 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit  au sein de l’institution. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active depuis 14 ans dans le secteur du commerce de  bijoux en plaque (chaine, colliers) et de chaussures. 
Madame S. sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat de marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Les revenus de son mari ne permettant pas de satisfaire l’intégralité  des besoins de la famille c’est la raison pour laquelle elle souhaite avec son financement renforcer son activité et par conséquent  augmenter ses revenus dans le but d’être plus autonome c'est-à-dire avoir la capacité de prendre en charge certains de ses besoins personnels ainsi que  ceux de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Anta S., 52, lives in the Cite Ndiobene district of Baye Laye on the outskirts of Guediawaye. She has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since January 2010 and has not yet received a loan from the institution. She is married and the mother of five children. For 14 years, she has been working selling costume jewelry (chains, necklaces) and shoes. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy more of the merchandise she sells. The income of her husband is not sufficient to cover all the needs of their family, so she wants to bolster her little business and thus increase her earnings in order to be more independent, that is, to be able to cover some of her own and her children's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Carlos Freddy

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos casado, que trabaja en transporte desde hace 15 años, en el sindicato de taxi Trufi Litoral, es esposo de una cliente antigua, quien recomendo a su esposo, tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, la esposa trabaja de empleada del hogar, el Sr. Carlos, tiene su casita propia pero ahora vive en un departamento en anticretico, esto debido a que su vivienda fue afectada por la construcción del camino a Palca por la Costanera, lugar donde vivio muchos años, zona que se encuentra en final Los pinos, el destino del crédito es para el mantenimiento y arreglo de caja de cambios, ya que debido a un asalto que tuvo, donde le robaron el vehiculo, lo recupero, pero le faltaban repuestos y los comprara con el credito solicitado, A pesar de las adversidades el Sr. carlos supo salir adelante y esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos is married to a former client who recommended him. He has worked in transportation for 15 years and belongs to the taxi union Trufi Litoral. He has a school aged son and his wife is employed as a domestic worker. Carlos owns a small house but is currently living in a rented apartment because his home was affected by road construction happening on la Costanera, the road leading to the town of Palta. He lived there for many years. Carlos had his car stolen, but was able to recover it, though some parts were missing. He will use the loan to repair and maintain a gearbox and to replace stolen parts. In spite of these adversities, Carlos has learned to press on and is very thankful for the support offered to him.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: VEHICLE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE

loans.name: Marc

texts.fr: Né en 1968 à Ifangni dans le département du Plateau au Bénin, D. Marc est marié à DJOSSOU Félicité, une ménagère. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Marc vit depuis sept ans environs à Danmin, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marc a très peu fréquenté l’école, et a appris ensuite le métier de meunier. Marc exerce cette activité depuis onze ans environs. De façon secondaire, Marc fait de l’élevage à son domicile. Marc achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marc sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et d’acquérir deux autres moulins à maïs et à manioc ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Ifangni in the Plateau province of Bénin, D. Marc is married to DJOSSOU Félicité, housewife. The couple is raising four children, of whom two are their biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. Marc has been living for about seven years in Danmin, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, with his wife and children. The couple share in covering the expenses of the family. Marc was not able to attend school for very long and afterwards learned the miller's trade. He has been working in this trade for about eleven years. Secondarily, he raises livestock at their home. He buys his products in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Marc is requesting from ALIDé a loan intended to bolster his business and acquire two other mills, one for maize and another for manioc. This will allow him to better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a mill for manioc and another for maize

loans.name: Socorro Maria

texts.es: Socorro Maria se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales comercializa en el mercado. Este no el primer crédito que tiene Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus pagos. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a esta actividad por su mama que le enseño este negocio. Poco a poco ella fue obteniendo la experiencia necesaria, así sus clientes se acercan para comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece. Sueña con seguir creciendo cada día más con su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de melones, sandias, naranjas, chiltomos, cebollas, tomates y mangos.
texts.en:
Socorro Maria sells fruits and vegetables in the market. This is not the first loan she has had with the Fundación. She has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person with her payments. She has been doing this activity for over 23 years; her mother taught her this business. Little by little she was gaining the necessary experience so that her customers come to buy the different products she sells. She dreams of continuing to grow more each day in her business. The loan is to buy melons, watermelons, oranges, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and mangoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more guinea-pigs and chickens

loans.name: Patzolojche Group

texts.es: Doña Francisca Pelicó C.  con  5 hijos, es una persona  trabajadora, y a pesar de su extrema pobreza esta señora ha salido adelante en  forma un grupo de señoras, del Paraje Patzolojche de la aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, del municipio de Momostenango del departamento de Totonicapán, que es la representante de este grupo denominado “PATZOLOJCHE”. Ella y sus tres integrantes se dedican se dedican a la  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino, vacuno y también aves domesticas como pollos ponedoras y de engorde, y pavos para engorde. Doña Francisca es también una persona entusiasta a pesar de su poca escoralidad, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el paraje Pologuá, de la aldea  San Antonio Pasajoc, Momostenango. Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de la familia de cada una de la integrantes de este grupo.
texts.en:
Francisca Pelicó C. has five children, and she is a hard-working person. In spite of her extreme poverty, this woman has gotten ahead. She is part of a group of women, Paraje Patzolojche, in the San Antonio neighborhood. This is in the Momostenango municipality in the Totonicapán department. She is the representative of this group called “Patzolojche”. She and the other three members raise animals like pigs and cows. They also raise poultry like laying hens and chickens and turkeys to fatten. Francisca is also an enthusiastic person in spite of her small amount of schooling. She is someone who has profited from raising animals. She sells these animals in the Paraje Pologuá in the San Antonio Pasajoc neighborhood in Momostenango. She needs to increase her working capital in her business of raising animals. This is the second loan that she has asked for from the ASDIR Asociación of Pologuá. She wants the loan for her economic activity in order to be able to improve her living conditions and those of the families of each of the members of this group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Noudagnon

texts.fr: A. Noudagnon est né le 21 Janvier 1979 à Podji au Bénin. Marié à HOUNKANRIN Bernadette, une revendeuse, Noudagnon est père d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Noudagnon a un autre enfant à charge. Noudagnon vit depuis sa naissance  au quartier Adonvê à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Noudagnon vit avec sa famille dans ce quartier. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Noudagnon a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite l’électricité. Noudagnon exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs. De façon secondaire, Noudagnon vend également du charbon de bois. Noudagnon s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de s’équiper en matériels électriques, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Noudagnon sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Noudagnon ambitionne plus tard ouvrir une boutique de vente de matériels électriques, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
A. Noudagnon was born on January 21, 1979 in Podji in Bénin. Married to HOUNKANRIN Bernadette, a petty trader, Noudagnon is the father of one child who is attending school. Noudagnon is also raising another child. Since his birth, Noudagnon has been living in the Adonvê area in Ekpè, in the township of Sèmè-Podji. Noudagnon still lives with his family in this district. The couple share in supporting their family. Noudagnon left school at the secondary level and learned the trade of electrician. He has been working in this trade for about seven years. Secondarily, he sells charcoal. He buys his supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. In order to raise the level of his business and equip himself with electrical supplies, and thus better serve his clientele, Noudagnon is requesting, for the first time, a loan from ALIDé. He hopes later on to be able to open a store selling electrical goods, which would allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of electrical goods (pipes, wires, bulbs, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca, pertenece al circuito turístico de playas de la región y se encuentra ubicado a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a vender cerveza en su vivienda, ella empezó su negocio ayudando a un familiar en la venta y distribución de su producto y poco a poco se hizo conocida en el rubro, luego pudo sacar sus propios pedidos y actualmente maneja un negocio de venta y distribución. Este negocio es de suma importancia para la economía de su familia ya que, gracias a el, ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Conforme ha pasado el tiempo el negocio de María Violeta se ha hecho mas conocido, actualmente ella desea comprar mas cajas de cerveza para seguir adelante con su negocio de distribución y venta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Violeta es una mujer responsable y que siempre ve la manera de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Ella nos comenta que actualmente ya está construyendo su casa propia y que su mayor anhelo es verla terminada para mudarse allí. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Violeta, 39, lives with her husband and three children in Santa Rosa, a district whose economy depends primarily on fishing. It is part of the tourist beach circuit in the region and is located twenty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years she has sold beer from her home; she started the business helping a relative sell and distribute the product. Gradually, she became well-known in this line of work and was able to get her own supplies and now runs her own sales and distribution business. This business is of great importance to her family’s finances because, thanks to it, she can help her husband support the household. As time has passed, María Violeta’s business has becme still better known and she wants to buy more cases of beer so that she can continue selling and distributing it. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to reach this goal. María Violeta is a responsible woman who is always looking for ways to help her family get ahead. She tells us that she is currently building her own home and her greatest wish is to see it finished so that they can move into it. She has collaborated with our Institution previously and has been responsible and punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with an 18-year-old daughter. Yuliya lives in Energodar and sells seeds, agricultural chemicals and other farming products in the central market of her home town. She owns a big vending location and is an experienced vendor who offers a reasonable pricing policy to her customers. She has learned many tricks of her trade in the past eight years.

Currently, Yuliya has already invested 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yuliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, like fertilizers and seeds, for the upcoming farming season. She can quickly respond to different new trends in her business which, in addition to high demand on these types of product, has benefited her venture.

This client has big potential and is full of business ideas and projects. Yuliya is hoping to generate sufficient income to re-invest it in further expansion of the range of items she offers for sale, e.g. irrigation units and sprayers.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bovines

loans.name: Godonou Justin

texts.fr: D. Godonou Justin est né le 23 Juin 1978 et est marié à KINSOU Bernadette, une ménagère. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi ces enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a environs cinq ans que Justin s’est installé au quartier Tohouè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il vit avec ses enfants et sa femme. Justin et Bernadette se partagent les différentes charges familiales. Justin a très peu fréquenté l’école. C’est un meunier, ayant près de quinze ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité. De façon secondaire, Justin fait de l’élevage, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Justin s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais exerce son activité à son domicile. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle, Justin sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Godonou Justin was born on June 23, 1978 and is married to KINSOU Bernadette, housewife. The couple is raising four children, all enrolled in school. Among these, two are their biological children. About five years ago, Justin settled in the Tohouè neighborhood of Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and children. Justin and Bernadette share in supporting their family. Justin barely attended school. He is a miller with 15 years of experience in his trade. Secondarily, he raises livestock which allows him several sources of income. He gets his supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, but does his work at his home. Wishing to expand his business and better service the various needs of his customers, Justin is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the very first time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a mill for palm fruit

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.es: EL SR. CRESENCIO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, TIENE SU DOMICILIO EN EL BARRIO EL PARAISO DE DICHA LOCALIDAD, TIENE 3  HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES SEPARADO DE SU ESPOSA, CUENTA EL SR. CRESENCIO QUE LA SEPARACION CON SU ESPOSA FUE MUY DOLOROSA PARA EL Y PARA SUS HIJOS,PERO PUDO SOBRELLEVAR LA SEPARACION Y AHORA REALIZA SUS ACTIVIDADES NORMALMENTE, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA DE CARPINTERIA, CONTRUYE Y REPARA MUEBLES A PEDIDO Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE TRABAJA COMO MOTOTAXISTA(TRANSPORTE DE PASAJERO URBANO), ESTA AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR BRINDARLE EL APOYO FINANCIERO. SU DESEO ES  AYUDARLES A SUS HIJOS QUE TENGAN UNA PROFESION, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MADERA PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE MUEBLES YA QUE TIENE VARIOS PEDIDOS.
texts.en:
Cresencio lives in El Torno, which is 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. His home is in the El Paraiso neighborhood of El Torno. He has three school age children, and he is separated from his wife. Cresencio says that the separation from his wife was very hard for him and his children. But, they got past the separation, and they now participate in their activities normally. His main activity is carpentry. He builds and repairs furniture based on prior orders. In his free time he works driving a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle used for urban passenger transportation). He is grateful to the institution for providing him with financial support. His wish is to help his children have a profession. He will use the money from the loan to buy wood to make furniture because he already has various orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Flor De Rosa Group

texts.es: Doña Julia A. C.  cuenta  8 hijos, es una persona  trabajadora, y a pesar de su extrema pobreza esta señora ha salido adelante en  La  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino,   y también  ella es una persona entusiasta a pesar de su poca escoralidad, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,   y lograr incrementar su negocio de crianza de animales  y lograr apoyar a su esposo en el gasto de la familia,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el municipio de San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,  y apoyar en el crecimiento de la economía del país. Por esto ella y dos personas más forman un grupo de señoras, del Paraje Chocaja,  de la Aldea Chivarreto, del municipio de San Francisco El Alto, departamento de Totonicapán,  con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias en las actividades que realizan.
texts.en:
Julia A. C. has 8 children. She is a hard-working person who, despite her extreme poverty, has managed to succeed raising animals like pigs. Despite her lack of formal schooling, she is an enthusiastic person who has reaped benefits from raising animals allowing her to increase her business and help her husband support their family. She sells her animals in San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán and needs to increase her working capital raising animals. This is her second loan request from ASDIR’s Pologuá’s office aimed at financing her commercial activity and improving her family’s living conditions as well as contributing to the country’s economic growth. For this reason, she and two other persons from Paraje Chocaja, Chivarreto, San Francisco El Alto, Totonicapán formed a group in order to earn better profits in each of their commercial ventures.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Paola Mayela

texts.es: Paola Mayela tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad. Ella tiene un taxi, el cual lo alquila y todos los días sale a trabajar. Este taxi lo compro desde hace  6 años, y desde esa fecha ha salido buen vehículo. Actualmente desea invertirle al vehículo mantenimiento general y comprándole algunos repuestos, con el objetivo de que no tenga ningún problema. Sus problemas, al igual que todo transportista es el precio del combustible, que cada día se hace más caro. El sueño a corto plazo que desea cumplir la señora es comprar otra unidad, para brindar otro ingreso y otro empleo a la familia, ya que el vehículo que tienen es manejado por uno de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Paola Mayela is 30 years old; she is married and has two underage children. She has a taxi which she hires out and everyday she goes to work. She bought the taxi 6 years ago and since then it has been in a good state. At present, she wants to invest in the car by performing a general maintenance on it and to buy some spare parts so that there won’t be any problems. Her problems are the same as anyone in the transportation sector, mainly in gas prices which are increasing everyday. Her dream in the short term is to buy another vehicle to bring more income and another job for her family since the vehicle that she already owns is driven by one of her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Johana Sugey

texts.es: Johana Sugey S. O. una mujer trabajadora y esforzada quien el 2000 inicio su negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y electrodomesticos con el cual a sacado a delante a sus hijos de 17 y 15 años. Ella con el credito piensa cubrir los encargos que tiene en ropa e incurcionara en la realización de recargas.
texts.en:
Johana Sugey S. O. is a very hard-working woman. She started her business in 2000; she sells clothes, footwear and home appliances. With this business, she has been able to get her two children (17 and 15) ahead. With this loan she will cover the costs of clothing orders and to re-stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married. He is a bee farmer from Kherson. He breeds bees and sells honey and his apiculture has been bringing him a stable income for about seventeen years. He is a real professional: within the last few years he has invested over 15,200 Grivnyas in his business. His net profit amounts to 7,500 Grivnyas a month in high season.

Victor is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase bee families and beehives, as well as to cover expenses related to the migratory beekeeping business he runs.

Victor is a typical entrepreneur who desires to see his business grow and expand further. He is in the process of constructing a new private house for his family which is why he is hoping to use a portion of the generated income as an investment in this project.

loans.use: To purchase bee families and hives

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es:
