Don Alejandro es un hombre trabajador, padre de dos hijos, vive en el barrio Linda vista, juntos han construido su casa de concreto ya que ambos trabajan, y ahorran para poder hacer las mejoras. Su trabajo es la construcción desde hace varios años, inicio como ayudante y aprendió el cual ahora gana mejor y tiene un trabajo fijo en mantenimiento de la empresa. 
Hacen falta mejoras en su casa como poner el piso, hacer divisiones, mejorar las puertas. Su trabajo no es fácil, es cansado. Lo bueno es cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. Tiene materiales comprado como: piso y cemento para poner en su casa,  pero aun le hace falta material el cual espera poder pegarlo pronto y lograr una mejor higiene en su hogar.
Con este financiamiento comprara herramientas que le ayuden en su labor cotidiana, como: cerrucho, cepillo, maquina de soldar entre otros, ya que son de altos costos y no logra comprarlas de un solo, es por eso compra a trabes del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a hard-working married father of two. He lives in the Linda vista neighbourhood, and together he and his family built his house out of concrete. They both work and save up to make home improvements. Alejandro has worked in construction for several years; he began as an assistant and learned from there. He now makes more money and has a steady job maintaining the business. He needs to make improvements to his house, such as laying a floor, making room divisions, and improving the doors. His job is not easy; he is tired. Luckily, he can count on the help of his wife. He has bought materials such as flooring and cement for the house, but he still needs more material and he hopes to get the improvements done soon in order to have better hygiene in his home. With this loan, he will buy tools to help him with his daily work, such as: a handsaw, a plane, and a welder, among others. These cost a lot and he has not managed to buy them on his own; thus, he will buy them with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tools for home improvements

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: K. Noëlie est née le 23 Décembre 1971, et est mariée à SAGBO Jean, un vitrier. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Noëlie s’est installée à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, et y vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Noëlie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans environs, Noëlie vend des céréales et des produits vivriers à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Noëlie vend des condiments de sauce, ce qui lui permet de se faire plus de revenus. Noëlie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité et à reconstituer son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Noëlie K. was born on December 23, 1971; she is married to Jean Sagbo, a glass installation technician. The couple has seven children, some of whom go to school. About seven years ago, Noëlie settled in Djeffa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where she now lives with her husband and children. Noëlie never attended school. Since about seven years ago, she has been selling cereals and staple foods from her home. In addition, she also sells sauce condiments, which allows her to increase her revenues. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is her first time seeking a loan from ALIDé, which would allow her to strengthen her business and restock her goods, in order to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple foods (corn, rice) for resale

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Vida”, and this is the second time they have a loan published on Kiva.  The members of this bank are from the city of Temuco, and they are involved in the activities of pastry-making, chocolate-making, sewing, selling cakes, frozen foods, coal, wood, and salads.
The group member interviewed was Macarena, who is the group’s president.  In the photo Macarena is in the last row, to the right, with a baby (the daughter of another group member) in her arms.
Macarena and Ingrid, another of the group members who she taught to make chocolates, make and sell the chocolates together.  They sell in various restaurants and kiosks, and in schools.
Macarena will invest this loan in materials and ingredients to make the chocolates, and in silver jewelry to expand her business.
Her dream is to have an internet café in her house or in Ingrid’s, for which they are applying for a “capital semilla” (seed capital) from a government program.
Macarena’s greatest motivation is her 5-year-old daughter – to assure a good economic future for her through her studies and everything she will need.
What Macarena likes most about Fondo Esperanza are the good moments she lives with her group and their loan officer during the group meetings, when they do their entrepreneur-training workshops and share their experiences.
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: Jewelry and ingredients to make chocolates

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: EL SR. JULIO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SAN JOSE COMUNIDAD DE LA GUARDIA DISTANTE 25 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, PADRE DE UN HIJO, ES DE OCUPACION TRANSPORTISTA( TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS ), PERTENECIENTE A LA LINEA DE TRANSPORTE DE LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO, SE ESTA RECUPERANDO ECONOMICAMENTE YA HACE UNOS AÑOS TUVO UN ACCIDENTE DE TRANSITO DE CONSIDERACION,  POR TAL MOTIVO VENDIO PARTE DE SU CASA PARA SALIR UN POCO ADELANTE, EL SR. JULIO ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE ESTA VELANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE LA FAMILIA YA QUE EL SOLO MANTIENE EL HOGAR Y DESPUES DEL ACCIDENTE PASARON MALOS MOMENTOS COMO FAMILIA PERO SOBRELLEVARON LOS PROBLEMAS Y SALIERON ADELANTE POR LO CUAL EL SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR DARLE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE LEVANTARSE ECONOMICAMENTE.
texts.en:
Julio lives in San Jose in the La Guardia community. It is 25 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He has one child. He is a driver (transports passengers). He is a member of the El Torno transportation line. He is recovering economically. Some years ago he had a serious traffic accident. He sold part of his house in order to get a little ahead. Julio is a responsible and hard-working person. He is always looking out for the well-being of his family. He maintains his home by himself. After the accident the family experienced some bad times. But, they overcame the problems caused by the serious accident, and got ahead. He is grateful to the institution for giving him the opportunity to lift himself up economically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Nery Lisseth

texts.es: Nery Lisseth tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas y leña. A pesar de ser una actividad muy humilde ha sabido manejar su negocio de la mejor manera posible. Pues por medio de esta actividad es que les ha proporcionado a sus 2 hijos menores de edad lo necesario. Ella dio inicio hace 7 años cuando no tenía suficiente dinero para mantener a su familia, la ubicación es en su vivienda pues la mayoría de sus clientes son sus mismos vecinos y algunas personas que son de  otras comunidades. Este el motivo de su financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nery Lisseth is 31 years old, she sells tortillas and firewood. Despite being in a very humble profession she has been able to manage her business in the best way possible. Through this activity she has been able to give her 2 underage children what they need. She began her business 7 years ago and did not have enough money to sustain her family, the location of her home has helped her since most of her customers are her neighbors and people from other neighborhoods. The purpose for her loan is to buy raw materials. Her wish is to increase her work capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Paraje  Centro 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario S. Pelicó  ella tiene 1 hijo , es una persona  trabajadora, con baja escolaridad y a pesar de su extrema pobreza esta señora ha salido adelante, con sus familia y su esposo  en  La  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino, y ganado,    ella es una persona entusiasta a pesar de su  ignorancia estudiantil, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,   y lograr incrementar su negocio de crianza de animales  y lograr apoyar a su esposo en el gasto de la familia,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, municipio de San Momostenango,  Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,  y apoyar en el crecimiento de la economía del país. Este grupo de señoras residen en el Paraje Centro de la aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Municipio de Momostenango del  departamento de  Totonicapán. Es un grupo integrado por 4 personas.
texts.en:
Rosario S. Pelicó has one child. She is a hard-working person with little education. In spite of her extreme poverty she has gotten ahead, with her family and her husband, in raising animals. She raises animals like pigs and livestock. She is an enthusiastic person in spite of her lack of education. She is a person who has profited from raising animals, and she has increased her business of raising animals. She has helped her husband with the family expenses. She sells these animals in Paraje Pologuá in the San Antonio Pasajoc village, San Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán. She needs to increase her working capital in her business of raising animals. This is the second loan she has requested in the Pologuá offices of the Asociatión ASDIR. The loan is to be able to finance her economic activity. This way she will be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. This will support the economic growth in her country. This group of women lives in El Paraje Centro in the San Antonio Pasajoc village, San Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán. The group is comprised of four people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Justina Maria

texts.es:
Justina de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años. Para tener ingresos ella tuvo que remodelar su casa y vender víveres a sus vecinos, poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeña tienda, pero cuando sus hijos demandaban mas gastos, ella empezó a hacer panes y venderlos en una pequeña vitrina en su tienda. 

Poco a poco fue teniendo mas ingresos con los panes, ahora ella trabaja sola produciendo y vendiendo panes, desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h30pm todos los días. 

Quiere que su negocio tenga mas variedad por eso quiere comprar harina, arroz, y levadura para su panadería. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Justina is 39 years old she lives in an urban area in Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She is a single mother and has two children of 10 and 8 years of age. To have some income she had to remodel her home and sell supplies to her neighbors, little by little her little store grew but when her children required more expenses she began to make bread and sold them in a small display cabinet in her store.

Little by Little she earned more income with her breads and now she works alone making and selling the bread from 6 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. everyday.

She wants her business to have more variety of products and wants to buy flour, rice and yeast for her bakery. In the future she wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, rice and yeast.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: D. Jean est né le 02 Août 1977 à Dangbo, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Marié à VODOUNON Ange, Jean est père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Il y a près de vingt six ans que Jean s’est installé au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où il vit avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Jean a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire, puis a appris le métier d’électricien bâtiment. Parallèlement à son activité, Jean vend des matériaux électroniques dans sa boutique située à Agbalilamè. Jean achète ses produits à Cotonou. C’est la première fois que Jean sollicite de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Jean D. was born on 2 August 1977 in Dangbo, in the district of Ouémé. Married to Ange VODOUNON, Jean is the father of five children, all of whom are educated. The couple also takes care of another child. For nearly 26 years, Jean has been living with his family in the Agbalilamè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple both contribute to taking care of their family. Jean attended school until the secondary level, after which he learned the trade of an electrician. In addition to this activity, Jean sells materials related to electricity in his shop located in Agbalilamè. Jean purchases his supplies in Cotonou. This is the first time that Jean is asking for a loan from ALIDé to supplement his activity and increase the stock of his products, in order to better satisfy the requests of his clients.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing electrical supplies (wires, bulbs, hoses, etc)

loans.name: Kounta

texts.fr: Monsieur Kounta N. est un gérant de boulangerie à Guediawaye. Il  a une activité très diversifiées. Il est  commerçant  et en même  temps  technicien en construction métallique. Il est âgé de 30ans et habite dans le quartier de Wakhinane.Il  est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis 4 ans et a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Monsieur N. est propriétaire d’une place au marche ou il commercialise des denrées  alimentaires comme les pommes de terre, les oignons et différents condiments utilises par les femmes dans la préparation  des repas quotidiens.  Ainsi il est très souvent seconde par sa mère et son frère  dans la gestion de son commerce surtout pendant les moments de fête  ou les produits sont très sollicites. Par conséquent  il emprunte 500 000 frs destines a l’achat de denrées  pour mieux renforcer son stock.  Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le bon fonctionnement  de ses activités commerciales et de mieux gérer l’épanouissement  financier de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kounta N. manages a bakery in Guediawaye. He has a very diverse business. He is the shopkeeper and metal constructor technician at the same time. He is 30 years old and lives in the Wakhinane quarter. He has been a member of Baye Laye bank for four years and has already received four previous loans. Mr. N. is the owner of a stall at the market where he trades foodstuff like potatoes, onions, and different condiments used by women for preparing everyday meals. He is also often second-in-command to his mother and brother in the management of his business, especially during holidays when his products are in demand. Thus, he is borrowing 500,000 frs for the purchase of foodstuff to increase his stock. These finances will allows him to ensure his business runs well and to better manage his family's development.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy insecticidees to protect his crops from infestations

loans.name: Joceline

texts.fr: A. Joceline est née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à PADONOU Marcellin, un maçon, Joceline est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seulement, trois des enfants restent à la charge de Joceline et de son mari. La famille vit à Ekpè III, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji,  depuis sept ans environs. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Joceline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de participer pleinement aux charges familiales, Joceline vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits de quincaillerie à Ekpè. C’est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Joceline achète ses produits. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux faire face aux divers exigences de sa clientèle, Joceline sollicite pour la première fois, un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Joceline was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Married to PADONOU Marcellin, a mason, Joceline is the mother of five children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Only three of the children are still the responsibility of Joceline and her husband. The family have been living in Ekpè III, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, for about seven years. The couple share the responsibility of supporting the family. Joceline did not go to school. In order to pay her own way and help support the family, she has been selling hardware for some 10 years in Ekpè. She buys her goods in Nigeria, a bordering state of Bénin, and in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Wishing to increase her working capital and her inventory, and thus better serve the needs of her clientele, Joceline is requesting, for the first time, a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items (paint, nails, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Romuald Léon

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Romuald Léon vit depuis vingt ans au quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Romuald Léon est marié à ADANLE Louise et est père de deux enfants qui sont scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble à Agblangandan. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Romuald Léon et sa femme. Romuald Léon a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une douzaine d’année, Romuald Léon vend de façon ambulante, des matériels électriques (lampes, réglettes, piles, etc.). Romuald Léon s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Romuald Léon sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. Romuald Léon ambitionne ouvrir prochainement une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, A. Romuald Léon has been living for 20 years in the Agblangandan district in the township of Sèmè-Podji. Romuald Léon is married to ADANLE Louise and is the father of two children who are enrolled in school. The couple is also responsible for one other child. They all live together in Agblangandan. Family expenses are shared between Romuald Léon and his wife. Romuald Léon left off school at the secondary level. For some 12 years he has been in the ambulant sales business, walking around selling electrical goods (bulbs, switches, batteries, etc.). He buys his goods in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Romuald Léon has requested a loan from ALIDé, with a view to raising the level of his little business and better serving his clientele. His ambition is to be able to open a little store to sell his goods in the near future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of electrical goods (wires, bulbs, switches, etc.)

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.fr: Monsieur Yakhya  S. est un menuisier de profession. Il habite a Baye Laye et est membre  de la caisse depuis mars 2006. Il a déjà bénéficie  de 2 prêts antérieurs. Il est marie  et père de famille. Il  s’active aussi dans l’aviculture par passion mais il cherche aussi  à  ’élargir  son domaine d’activité. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs afin d’augmenter le nombre de ses sujets  pour ainsi accroitre d’avantage ses bénéfices .Son objectif est de mieux prendre en charge la gestion des besoins de sa famille et de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Monsieur Yakhya S. is a trained carpenter. He lives in Baye Laye and has been a member of our branch there since March 2006. He has already received two prior loans. He is married and responsible for his family. He enjoys raising chickens but he would like to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to add to his poultry so as to earn more. His goal is to better support his family and be able to pay his children's school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his working capital

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y también por sus artesanías en madera, cerámica y junco, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente las ligadas a la ganadería: cuenta con trece vacas de las cuales seis producen leche diariamente, su establo se encuentra a media hora de camino de su vivienda,  todos los dias se dirige muy temprado por la mañana a ordeñar a sus vacas, la leche que estas producen es vendida a un acopiador de la zona. 

Como esta actividad es su única fuente de ingreso económico, Pablo siempre brinda a sus vacas una buena alimentación y cuidado, precisamente, ahora desea adquirir alimento balanceado y pastos naturales para mejorar la producción lechera de su ganado, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternatva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Pablo es un padre de failia que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza y que siempre se ha valido de ella para salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Pablo is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three children in the Monsefú district. This area is known on a regional level for its tourist and religious festivals. It is also known for its wood, ceramic, and reed handicrafts. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years he has done agricultural work, especially that having to do with livestock. He has 13 cows, and 6 of them produce milk daily. His stable is a half hour from his house. He goes there very early everyday to milk the cows. He sells the milk to a wholesaler in the area. As this activity is his only source of income, Pablo always feeds his livestock well and takes good care of them. He now wants to get balanced nutritional feed and natural grass to improve the milk production of his cows. That is why he has requested a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edypme Alternativa. Pablo is a family man who really likes the work he does. He has always counted on it to get ahead. He has worked with our institution before, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it is time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced nutritional feed and natural grass to improve the milk production of his cows

loans.name: Celestina  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Celestina es una mujer de 36 años de edad, con dos hijos, vive en el bario las agüitas, junto a su esposo que se desempeña como mensajero.
Ella trabaja como  conserje en una óptica para poder cubrir los gastos básicos de agua y luz ya que  Son de recursos económicos muy pobres, poco a poco han construido su casa de concreto, todavía hay partes de madera el cual cambiaran con el tiempo ya que no se ajusta por el momento para hacer las mejora. Con este financiamiento cerrara una parte de atrás de la casa y pondrá cerámica, para una mejor higiene ya que se le hace mucho lodo en el invierno y se multiplican los zancudos es por eso su necesidad de hacer la mejora.
texts.en:
Celestina is a 36 year old woman with two children. She lives in the "Las Agüitas" neighborhood with her husband who has a job as a courier. She works as a receptionist at an optician's so that she can cover the basic expenses of water and electricity since they have very little financial means. Little by little they have built their home from concrete, still there are sections of wood which they will change over time since it does not suit right now to make improvements. With this financing they will close off a section at the back of the house and will put in ceramics for better hygiene since it is very muddy in winter time and the mosquitoes multiply. This is why they need to make improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ceramics, cement, sand, to put in the back section and have better hygiene

loans.name: Boya  Nestor

texts.fr: D. Boya  Nestor est né en 1968 et est marié à KOUAKANOU Anne. Le couple a sept enfants à charge, dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Nestor s’est installé depuis quinze ans environs à Djèrègbé, sur la voie allant à Porto-Novo, où il vit avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les charges de la famille. Nestor a arrêté les études au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Nestor exerce cette activité depuis dix ans, activité qui l’aide à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Nestor sollicite pour une première fois, un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, afin d’acquérir certains équipements nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier de coiffure, ce qui lui permettrait de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Plus tard, Nestor ambitionne ouvrir d’autres ateliers de coiffure, pour accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Boya Nestor was born in 1968 and is married to KOUAKANOU Anne. The couple is raising seven children, six of whom are their biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. About 15 years ago, Nestor settled in Djèrègbé, on the road to Porto-Novo, where he lives with his family. The couple share in supporting their family. Nestor left school at the secondary level, then learned barbering. He has been working at this business for 10 years; the income from it allows him to support his family only with great difficulty. Nestor is asking for a loan, for the first time, from ALIDé, so as to acquire certain necessary materials that will allow his barber shop to function better so that he can satisfy his clientele. Later on, Nestor would like to open other barber shops so as to grow his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clippers and adjustable chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items

loans.name: Aminta Elene

texts.es: La señora Aminta Elene tiene un negocio que es la venta de granos básicos ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado directamente a los campesinos. Pues de esta forma le resulta mucho más favorable, por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora lo que le ha dado la mejor ayuda ha sido la buena administración de su negocio el manejo de sus ganancias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo así comprar granos básicos al por mayor para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo. Ella desea mejorar cada día las condiciones de su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminta Elene has a business where she sells basic grains in her home and she buys it directly from the farmers. She is a hardworking woman and what has helped her is a good administration of her business and managing her earnings. The loan that she needs is for work capital to buy basic grains wholesale and to use it in her business and make it more productive. She wishes to improve the living conditions of her home each day and to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur Bassirou Silla est  un habitant du quartier de Wakhinane. Il est Age  d’une quarantaine d’années. Il est marie sans enfants. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye laye depuis décembre 2008.Monsieur Silla est un chauffeur de profession dans le secteur du transport  en commun de la banlieue  de Dakar. Mais parallèlement il mène une activité  commerciale d’achat et de vente de produits  locaux depuis 2 ans. Auparavant il était apprenti  de car rapide et après sa maitrise il a obtenu son permis de conduire et trouvé un travail de chauffeur de minibus. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de mil, niébé, destines a la vente. Ses bénéfices lui permettront  de compléter son salaire afin qu’il puisse subvenir a l’intégralité de ses besoins sociaux
texts.en:
Mr. Bassirou Silla lives in the Wakhinane area. He is around 40, married, but without children. He has been a member of our Baye Laye branch since December 2008. Mr. Silla works as a professional driver in the public transport sector of the suburbs of Dakar. At the same time, he has been buying and selling local produce for the past two years. In the beginning, he was a rapid transport (bus) apprentice; when he got his driver's license, he found work driving a minibus. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy millet and niébé (a local seed), for resale. His profit will allow him to complement his salary so that he can fully support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his working capital

loans.name: Zannou Moïse

texts.fr: E. Zannou Moïse est né le 16 Septembre 1984 à Aguégué au Bénin. Marié à DJOSSOU Colette, Moïse a sept enfants à charge, dont deux sont ses enfants. Tous les enfants de Moïse sont scolarisés. Il y a près de huit ans que Moïse s’est installé au quartier Klaké, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa femme et ses enfants. Moïse n’a pas été à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Moïse exerce cette activité depuis onze ans environs et a son atelier situé à son domicile. Moïse achète ses matériaux de coiffure à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Moïse sollicite un premier prêt de ALIDé, en vue d’acquérir certains matériaux nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier, ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Zannou Moïse E. was born on 16th September 1984 in Aguégué in Benin. Married to Colette DJOSSOU, Moïse has seven children in his care, two of which are his own children. All his children are at school. Almost eight years ago Moïse settled down with his wife and children in the Klaké district of the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He did not go to school but learnt hairdressing. He has been carrying out this activity for around 11 years and his salon is at home. Moïse buys his hairdressing equipment in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, with a view to acquiring certain equipment which is necessary for the smooth running of his salon. This will allow him to satisfy better his customers' demands.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing equipment (chairs with caster wheels, clippers etc.)

loans.name: Raymond C. Adéyè

texts.fr: F. Raymond C. Adéyè est né le 23 Novembre 1977 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Raymond vit depuis vingt ans environs, à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Marié à OKRI Véronique, Raymond a sept enfants à charge, dont six sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Raymond sont scolarisés. Raymond vit avec sa famille à Lokokoukoumè. Raymond a très vite arrêté l’école. Grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, Raymond subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Raymond vend en effet, des matériaux électriques (fils, lampes, tuyaux, etc.) de façon ambulante. Raymond achète ses articles à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raymond exerce cette activité depuis près de huit ans. C’est la première fois que Raymond sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Raymond C. Adéyè F. was born 23 November 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Raymond has been living for the past 20 years in Loukoukoumé, part of the Sèmè-Podji commune. Married to Véronique OKRI Raymond has seven children to care for, of whom six are his own children. All of Raymond’s children attend (or have attended) school, and the family lives together in Loukoukoumé. Raymond stopped going to school at an early age. Thanks to the income provided by his business activity, he is able to meet his family’s needs. Indeed, Raymond sells electrical supplies (wire, light bulbs, tubing, etc.) as an itinerant vendor. He gets his supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and has been performing this activity for the past eight years. This is the first time Raymond has requested a loan from ALIDé, to raise the level of his activity and better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy electrical supplies (wire, light bulbs, tubing, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pea seeds

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny Elizabeth tiene 39 años. La actividad económica es la repostería y el alquiler de sillas. Hace más 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la única actividad que tiene también es la venta de mercadería en general, pues siempre está buscando la manera de llevar ingresos a su vivienda, pues como toda madre responsable tiene que hacerse cargo de la manutención de sus hijos.  El dinero solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria. El sueño de Jenny es seguir aumentando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jenny Elizabeth is 39 years old. Her economic activity is a pastry shop and she also rents chairs. For more than 13 years she has worked on her business and it is not her only business since she also sells general merchandize and is always looking for a way to increase the income for her home as any responsible mother does when taking care of her children. The money needed will be used as work capital to buy the necessary raw materials. Jenny’s dream is to keep increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vida Plena esta formado por señoras que buscan mejorar la salud de sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos naturales que mejoran su salud, todas son mujeres luchadoras, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad mas importante económicamente del Ecuador, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus iglesias, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad y la calidez de su gente así como nuestras socias.
  
La Sra. María G. se encuentra en su segundo ciclo que realiza los créditos en la fundación y nos comenta que es un buen apoyo para la venta de sus productos.
La Señora María vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Narancay Bajo, tiene 36 años es madre soltera y ha procreado 4 hijos de 16 años gemelos y de 12 y 6 años de edad, lo dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos últimos hijos están en la escuela, sus hijos no tienen ningún apoyo de parte de su padre, esta orgullosa de contar con su casa propia.
Nuestra socia ha comenzado ha consumir los productos de Omnilife, hace 4 años y hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de este prestigioso producto, le va muy bien vende solo medio tiempo ya que le dedica también tiempo a sus hijos y familia.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos naturales de la misma marca, su meta es llegar a comprarse un carro para facilitarse en la venta de su producto.

La Sra. María P. vive en la parroquia de Tarqui, se dedica  a la venta de productos Omnilife, se ha dedicado a la venta de estos productos hace 4 años y vende sus productos todos los días sin tener un solo día de descanso, sale a vender su producto desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y es el sustento de la casa junto con su hermana ya que viven solas con su mamá, cuentan con su casa propia.
Nuestra socia se encuentra dos ciclos en el banco comunal y el dinero que ha obtenido le ha beneficiado para comprar más productos y es en lo que va invertir este crédito, su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio para mejorar la economía de su hogar y poder ayudarle a su mamá.
texts.en:
The community bank Vida Plena is made up of women who want to improve the health of their customers through offering natural health products. They are all fighters. The women live in Cuenca, the third most economically important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is known for its churches, the four rivers that surround the city, and the warmth of its people, like these group members. María G. is entering her second loan cycle, and says that it is a good support for her business. Maria lives in the outskirts of Cuenca, in the Narancay Bajo sector. She is a 36-year-old single mother of 4 children, ages 12 and 6, and 16-year-old twins. The twins go to a high school in the city, and the two younger children are in elementary school. They do not get any support from the father, and are proud to own their own home. Maria began using Omnilife products 4 years ago and started selling this prestigious product 2 years ago. It is going very well and she only works part-time, since she also dedicates time to her children and family. Her credit will be invested in the purchase of more natural products from Omnilife; her goal is to eventually buy a car to facilitate her sales. Maria P. lives in the Tarqui parish, and has sold Omnilife products for 4 years. She sells every day without a single day of rest. She leaves to sell her products at 8 am and works until 8 pm. Maria is 42, single, and is the main earner in her household, along with her sister; they live alone with their mother in their own home. She has had two loan cycles in the community bank, and the money she has obtained has allowed her to buy more products. She will invest this credit in more products; her goal is to expand her business in order to improve the economic situation of her home and help her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Omnilife natural health products

loans.name: Walter Javier

texts.es:
Walter tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el caserío Los Peches, una zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en un corral situado a espaldas del domicilio donde vive, cuando estos ya han alzanzado un tamaño y peso adecuados los vende a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Las ganancias que percibe de este negocio las invierte en solventar sus gastos personales y en ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Walter siempre trata de brindarle a sus animales una buena alimentación, de modo que se desarrollen correctamente y tengan muy buena acogida por parte de sus compradores. Actualmente desea adquirir mas animales pequeños y alimento balanceado para terminar de criarlos, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Walter es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, su mayor anhelo es poder instalar una granja y estudiar alguna carrera técnica que le permita mejorar el método de crianza que aplica con sus animales. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Walter is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents. His home is located in the rural Los Peches settlement, in the Mochumí district. It is an agricultural area belonging to the Lambayeque province, situated 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 4 years he has raised and sold animals. He raises barnyard birds and small animals in a poultry yard located behind the house where he lives. When the birds have reached an adequate size and weight he sells them to the traders who often visit the area where he lives. The earnings he receives from this business are used to cover his personal expenses and to help support the finances of the family. Walter always tries to provide his animals with quality feed, so that they develop properly and are well received on the part of his buyers. Currently he wants to acquire more young animals and also buy the nutritionally balanced feed to finish raising them. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Walter is a hardworking youth whose main desire is to be able to establish his own farm and to study for a technical degree that will enable him to improve his methods of livestock production. He has already worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his livestock business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: A. Marie est née en 1972 et est mariée à ZOUNVOESSI Célestin, un pêcheur. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, mais deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Marie vit avec sa famille depuis cinq ans au quartier Kadjacomè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marie n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les charges de ses enfants, Marie vend des poissons et crevettes de façon ambulante. Marie achète ses produits à Cotonou. Marie exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans environs, et a déjà également bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé. Tous les crédits antérieurs qu’elle avait reçus ont été bien remboursés. Face à  la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Marie ambitionne augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, afin de se faire aussi plus de profits. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Marie A. was born in 1972 and is married to the fisherman Celestin Zounvoessi. The couple care for three children, two of whom are their own. All of the children go to school. Marie has lived with her family for five years in the Kadjacome area of Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin. The couple work together to meet the family's needs. Marie never went to school. In order to survive and to be able to look after her children, Marie sells fish and prawns from a mobile street stall. Marie buys her produce in Cotonou. Marie has been doing this for about four years and she has already had four loans from ALIDE. All of her previous loans were repaid correctly. Due to incessant growth in customer demand, Marie intends to increase her stock and better serve her customers' needs so that she can further increase her profits. This is what led her to request another loan.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of fish and prawns

loans.name: Abdou Lahad

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou  Lahad G. est un bijoutier qui exerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Il habite à Wakhinane Guediawaye. Il  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre  2005. Il a déjà rembourse trois crédits antérieurs. Il est marie sans enfants. Monsieur G. a choisi cette activiste  qu’il a hérité  de ses parents .Il  est ne dans une famille de bijoutiers et  a été initie depuis le bas âge  par la famille .Actuellement il est devenu maitre bijoutier en gérant  ses propres activités. Il sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat d’or brut qui lui permettra de fabriquer des bracelets et des bijoux destines a la vente. Ce sont ses gains qui lui permettent de gérer  sa famille en toute  sécurité  compte tenu de la cherté de la vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Lahad G. has been a jeweler for more than 10 years. He lives in Wakhinane Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit association since December 2005. He has already repaid three previous loans. He is married with no children. Mr. G. inherited this business from his parents. He was born into a family of jewelers and was introduced to it at a young age. Currently, he has become a master jeweler by running his own business. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 XOF to purchase raw gold that he will use to make bracelets and jewelry to sell. The money he makes will allow him to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DINGUIRAYE depuis le 02 mars 2006 et 06 fois bénéficiaire de crédit au niveau de l'institution de microfinance CAURIE-MF. C'est un membre très engagé, dynamique et assidu ce qui lui a valu un assez bon niveau d'épargne.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels, du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait, du thé, de la cigarette etc... Elle vend également des œufs durs et le petit déjeuné. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital d'investissement afin de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises.

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en appuyant financièrement son mari.
texts.en:
Binta D. is a married, 26-year-old mother of two. She has been a member of the Dinguiraye Banc Villageois since March 2, 2006 and has received 6 loans from the microfinance institution Caurie Microfinance. She is very engaging, dynamic, and dedicated and this has enabled her to save up a good amount. She owns a shop where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, tea, cigarettes, etc. She also sells hard-boiled eggs and breakfast foods. Her new loan will allow her to increase her investment capital so she can purchase more goods. Her goal is to increase her savings, take care of her children, and improve her family's quality of life by supporting her husband financially.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her investment capital

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Colette est mariée à AYABA Ludovic, un maçon. Le couple a six enfants à charge, dont cinq sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de dix ans que Colette habite le quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Colette n’a pas été à l’école. Pour se prendre en charge, et venir en aide à son mari, Colette vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Colette vend de l’huile d’arachide et de la farine de manioc. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Colette se ravitaille. Colette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu six crédits qui ont été bien remboursés.  La clientèle de Colette s’accroît de plus en plus, et elle n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. C’est dont pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et pour faire face à la demande des clients que Colette sollicite un nouveau prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Colette A. is married to Ludovic Ayaba, a mason. The couple takes care of six children, five of whom are their own. For nearly ten years, Colette has lived in the Agblangandan quarter in the Sèmè-Podji commune with her husband and children. The couple handles the family's needs jointly. Colette never went to school. To help her husband out, Colette sells food items (rice, corn mush) at her house. She also sells peanut oil and cassava flour. She gets her stock from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Colette has been a long-time client of Alidé, having already received six loans that she has repaid in full. Colette's client base continues to grow and she is unable to meet the demand. She is requesting a new loan so she can meet this demand and improve her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and corn, and jugs of oil

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar B. est un habitant du quartier de Daroukhane. Il est âgé  de 34 ans et est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mai 2008. Il a déjà rembourse 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Monsieur B. est un électromécanique qui exerce aussi l’activité  de vente d’appareils portables. Après une formation théorique il a été embauche dans une entreprise de traitement de matière  plastique depuis 2008. Son salaire ne lui permettant pas de régler l’intégralité de ses charges familiales il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de portables qu’il va placer au niveau de ses collègues. Ces derniers   vont le payer a la fin du mois. Son financement va l’aider à renforcer son fond et avoir la capacité  de diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar B. is a resident of the Daroukhane district. He is 34 years old and has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2008. He has already repaid two previous loans. He is married and the father of two children, who are 4 and 7 years of age. Mr. B. is an electronics repairman who also has a business selling mobile phones. After some theoretical training, he was hired in 2008 by a company that processes plastics. His salary is not sufficient for covering all family expenses. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for buying mobile phones. He will deliver these phones to his colleagues, who are going to pay him at the end of the month. His financing will help him to boost his capital and to have the ability to diversify his commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting his capital

loans.name: Marlon Enrique

texts.es:
Don Marlon es un hombre trabajador, de edad de 32 años. Padre de familia de dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de comida que desde hace varios años logro poner, el cual trabaja en conjunto con su esposa para poder cubrir los gastos alimenticios, como de educación para sus hijos.

Con el financiamiento anterior logro aumentar su elaboración en alimentos variado, así como la construcción de un pequeño bajarete para una mejor comodidad para hacer la comida.
Con este financiamiento comprara: lata de aceite, quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carne, pollo, lácteos, bolsas plásticas para tener en inventario y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Las dificultades es que a veces no le pagan a tiempo la comida que da al crédito. Lo que le ocasiona retrasarse con sus pagos que espera mejorar en su negocio,  para equilibrarse.
texts.en:
Marlon is a hard-working , 32-year-old man. He is the father of two children, and his business is food sales. He managed to start this business several years ago and works together with his wife to cover their expenses, such as their children's education. With his previous loan he was able to increase the variety of foods he prepares and build a small covered porch so he could make food more comfortably. With this loan, he will buy cans of oil and quintals (1 quintal = 100 kg) of rice, beans, sugar, meat, chicken, dairy products, and plastic bags to have in inventory and provide better service to his customers. A difficulty for him is that he gives food to people on credit, and sometimes they do not pay him on time. This can cause him to get behind on his payments. Marlon hopes to improve this for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cans of oil, rice, beans, sugar, chicken, dairy products to prepare foods

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. sells locally-made spices, salted beef, groundnut (peanut) paste, onions, canned tomatoes, and so on, at Abura. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Efua uses her earnings to support her husband in looking after the family.

Efua will add the loan to her initial capital to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a bigger shop to sell from.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba K.’s husband is a farmer and together they look after their four children.  Araba has received junior high education.  She cooks wheat into porridge to sell at Abura. 

Araba helps her husband with her sales to provide clothing, food, shelter, and educate her school-going children.  Araba will use the loan to purchase extra wheat to cook and also to get a nicer table. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase extra wheat to cook and get a nicer table

loans.name: Zobeida Alexandra

texts.es:
Zobeida de 44 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es chofer ellos tiene 5 hijos. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ella vendía empanada (son bocaditos hechos con harina y rellenos de queso) pero como no era suficiente para mantener a sus hijos decidió hacer almuerzos pero repartiéndolos a domicilio. 

Desde ese tiempo ella y su hijo reparte almuerzos a domicilio a sus cliente que tiene por su sector desde las 12h00 hasta las 15h00pm, también vende almuerzos en el garaje de su casa. Vende los almuerzos desde su casa y en la tarde se encarga ella de repartirlos, en ocasiones su hija le ayuda. El almuerzo lleva sopa, segundo y un jugo natural y los vende a $ 1.25 c/u. 

Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar una cocina para tener mas rapidez al hacer las comidas. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Zobeida is 44 years old and lives in the suburbs in Guayaquil. Her husband is a driver. They have 5 children. She used to sell cheese pastry (bite-sized and made of flour and filled with cheese). But since this wasn’t enough to support their children, she decided to make lunches but with home delivery. Since then she and her son deliver lunches to the homes of her customers in her area from 12 until 3 pm. She also sells lunches in the garage of her house. She sells the lunches from her home and in the afternoon she is in charge of delivering them. Her daughter helps her occasionally. The lunch includes soup, a second course and a fresh juice. She sells them for $ 1.25 each. That is why she wants to buy a stove with the loan, in order to make the meals more quickly. She wants to have a restaurant in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stove

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba M. operates a provisions shop where she sells almost anything customers request at Abura.  Araba has attained senior high level in education.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a secretary of a company. 

Araba has been selling provisions for quite some time now. She provides a helping hand to her husband by clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy other goods customers are asking for such as groceries and stationery. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to establish another shop.

loans.use: buy other goods such as groceries and stationery

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a single parent who takes care of her only boy child. She has no formal educational background.  Adwoa sells cloth by moving from one household to the other at Abura. 

Adwoa uses the income she generates from her sales to look after her young but growing child.  Adwoa will use the loan to purchase assorted cloth for sale. With the new earnings from her extended business, Adwoa plans to save towards her child’s education. At the time of our visit, Adwoa was yet to get her new consignment.

loans.use: purchase assorted cloth for sale

loans.name: Kosima

texts.en: Kosima A. sells bread, sugar, 'gari' (cassava couscous), groundnuts, and Milo (cocoa drink powder) that has been bagged in smaller quantities near a school at Abura. Kosima has received junior high education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a security man. Together with her husband she is able to take care of the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy more things like candies and other sweets to meet the demand of the school children. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a better shop for her things.

loans.use: buy more things like candies, etc. for resale

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane D. habite dans le quartier de Ndiobene à Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre  2007 et a déjà solde 3 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père d’un  enfant âgé  de 2 ans. Il supporte aussi la charge de deux autres personnes. Monsieur D. est un agent administratif au ministère de l’environnement mais  il pratique aussi parallèlement l’élevage  de moutons vu que ses parents ont été  éleveurs  et vendeurs  de bétails  a la Seras dans le passe. Il trouve surtout son compte dans cette activité lors des événements  de Tabaski. Il emprunte 200 000 frs pour acheter de l’aliment de bétail pour nourrir son troupeau.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane D. lives in the Ndiobene district in Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since December 2007 and has already repaid three previous loans. He is married and the father of a 2-year-old child. He also supports two other people. Mr. D. is a representative at the ministry of the environment, but he also raises sheep, given that his parents have been livestock farmers and merchants at SERAS in the past. He derives a benefit from this business particularly at Tabaski events. He is borrowing 200,000 francs for buying fodder to feed his herd.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting his working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. is a single woman taking care of six dependents. She buys palm fruits and processes them into oil for sale in large quantities to her customers. She attended a commercial school where she learned how to cook our local foods and foods of other countries like Togo. 

Ama uses the profits she makes from her sales to provide the needs of her dependents.  Ama’s main purpose for taking the loan is to extend her palm oil production and also produce palm kernel oil for sale. She hopes to establish a small factory that will produce palm oil and palm kernel oil and if possible produce soap for sale.

loans.use: extend her palm oil production and also produce palm kernel oil for sale

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Leydi de edad de 32 años, es una madre dedicada a su familia como  a su trabajo, en la venta de cosmético y ropa. Desde hace varios años logro con el apoyo de su esposo y financiamiento de la  institución el aumento de su negocio como la mejora de su casa.

La necesidad que tiene es el cambio del zinc ya que esta en mal estado y desea mejorar para poder dar a sus hijos mejor seguridad.
Las ventas han estado bajas, pero no se deja de vender, desea invertir en producto nuevo para poder lograr la captación de clientes. Y mejorar sus ingresos ya que todo esta con costos altos y solo con el salario de su esposo no se ajusta.
texts.en:
Leydi is 32 years old. She is a mother who is dedicated to her family and her job selling cosmetics and clothes. Several years ago, with her husband's support and financing fom the institution, she was able to grow her business and improve her house. What she needs is to change the zinc sheeting because it is in poor condition and she wants to improve it to be safer for her children. Sales have been low, but she hasn't stopped selling. She wants to invest in new products to be able to attract new customers and improve her income, since everything is expensive and her husband's salary isn't enough.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc sheeting to change the roof of her house which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu M. sells salted fish, tomatoes, salt, and other provisions at Abura.  She is married and has two children. She has received senior high education and is married to a farmer. 

Memunatu helps her husband in taking care of their family with the money she makes from her sales. Memunatu will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Memunatu plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua K. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce and yams with 'palava' sauce at Abura.  Akosua has been through junior high school.  She is married to an Account Clerk and has a child with him. Akosua has been selling cooked rice and yams for about a year now. She helps her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and yams to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: buy more rice and yams to cook for sale

loans.name: Mame Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Mame Cheikh F. est un jeune tailleur de 26 ans qui a commence à exercer ce métier depuis 1999 après  avoir quitte les bancs de l’école. C’est en 2006 qu’il a ouvert un atelier de couture en association avec son frère qui a présentement  voyage et vit au Gabon. C’est une activité  qu’il a choisi par amour. Monsieur F.  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis janvier 2010 et il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs. L’objet de son prêt est l’achat d’une machine a coudre dans le but de renforcer son outil de production. Et avec l’accroissement de ses gains  il parviendra a mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille car il est célibataire mais soutien t ses parents qui sont établis  au village.
texts.en:
Mr. Mame Cheikh F. is a young tailor, aged 26, who started working at his trade in 1999 after having dropped out of school. In 2006, he opened a clothing workshop along with his brother, who is presently on travel and living in Gabon. Mr. F. chose tailoring for the love of it. He has been a member of Baye Laye branch since January 2010 and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs. The purpose of his loan is to buy a sewing machine with the aim of enhancing his tool of production. With the growth in his profit, he will manage betterin providing for his family, since he is unmarried and supports his parents, who are situated in the village.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Monsieur Magatte G. est un mécanicien  transporteur  conducteur d’un  car rapide depuis 10 ans. Il est marie, âgé de 57 ans, père et soutien d’une famille composée  de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 17 ans. Il a aussi en charge  5 autres parents. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juin 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution. Auparavant il était apprenti mécanicien  mais actuellement il est en possession d’un certificat en mécanique. C’est surtout pendant la période de Magal et de Tabaski que son activité connait un essor considérable. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour réparer son car rapide qui est tombe en panne. C’est un véhicule qui lui permet d’assurer le transport urbain des passagers et ceci lui procure des recettes journalières  qui lui permettent de gérer  sa famille et d’épargner régulièrement  pour régler  les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mr. Magatte G. has been a mechanic, goods carrier and driver of a fast coach for the past ten years. He is married, 57 years old and he is father and breadwinner for a family of five children, whose ages vary between two and 17 years old. He also has responsibility for five other relatives. He has been a shareholder-member of the Baye-Laye savings bank since June 2009 and has never had a loan from the institution. Previously, he was an apprentice mechanic but now he has a mechanics certificate. It is above all during the period of Magal and Tabaski that his activity really booms. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to repair his fast coach which has broken down. It is a vehicle which allows him to provide transport around town for his passengers, and this brings him a daily income, which enables him to manage his family and save on a regular basis to provide for unforseen expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  K. est ne dans la banlieue de Guediawaye ou il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2010. Monsieur K. est un salarie, infirmier d’état  a l’hôpital principal de Dakar. En même temps il fait des prestations de services liées  à son métier d’infirmier dans d’autres structures ou cliniques a Dakar. Il a choisi son activité par vocation. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 et 5 ans. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs afin de  compléter son épargne  et acheter un véhicule  pour son activité de transport. La diversification de son activité est un moyen de trouver une solution au caractère  insuffisant  de son salaire et de mieux faire face a la gestion de ses besoins de sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou K. was born in the suburb of Guediawaye, where he has been a member of the loan group Baye Laye since March 2010. Mr. K. is a salaried nurse by occupation at the main hospital in Dakar. At the same time, he provides services linked to his job as a nurse at other organizations or clinics in Dakar. He chose this side business because of his training. He is married and has 2 children whose ages vary from 1 to 5 years old. He is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs in order to increase his savings and to buy a vehicle for his business transportation. The diversification of his business is a means to find a solution to the insufficiency of his salary, and to better meet and manage his familial needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es oriunda de la provincia de Loja desde hace 25 años, se radicó en la provincia de Manabí, actualmente está formando parte del banco comunal Los Corrales situado en una localidad a las afuera de la ciudad de Montecristi.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad está casada tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, se dedica al comercio informal de ropa y zapatos para damas y caballeros, con los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación ha podido incrementar su negocio, nos comentó que  junto a su hija la señora Magdalena sale a recorrer por el sector donde viven, mientras que el esposo tiene otra actividad relacionada con la venta de productos lácteos, con los ahorros de toda la vida han podido comprarse tres vacas y son las que producen, ellos se encargan de preparar el queso y los demás derivados de la leche, para luego llevar a entregar a despensas y demás clientes.

La señora Magdalena invertirá su crédito en surtir su negocio viajara hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde están situado los grandes almacenes de ropa, el viaje lo realiza  cada cierto tiempo o por lo menos cuando tiene bastante pedidos, está muy agradecida con su amiga quien la motivo para que ingrese a las ventas, con el negocio la señora Magdalena está muy contenta porque ha podido ayudar con sus ganancias a su esposo en el hogar, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en pantalones, blusas, y zapatos la forma de vender es salir a visitar a sus clientes  les deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, una vez que recupera el capital vuelve a invertir en mercadería.
texts.en:
Magdalena came from the province of Loja 25 years ago. She moved to the province of Manabí and at present is a member of the communal bank Los Corrales, located in a community on the outskirts of the city of Montecristi. Our member is 43 years old, is married and has four children who are all adults. She is an informal vendor of clothes and shoes for women and men. With the loans she has recieved from the Foundation, she has been able to grow her business. She informed us that with her daughter, Magdalena goes out to travel the sector where they live, while her husband has another activity related to selling dairy products. With their life savings, they have been able to buy three cows and they are producing. They make the cheese and the other milk products and later deliver them to stores and other clients. Magdalena will invest her loan in diversifying her business. She will travel to Guayaquil where the big clothing stores are. She makes the trip periodically or at least when there are a lot of orders. She is very grateful to her friend who motivated her to get into sales. Magdalena is very happy with the business because she has been able to help her husband at home with her earnings. With this new loan she will invest in pants, blouses and shoes. She sells by going to visit her customers' houses. She sells on credit and collects every two weeks. Once she recovers the capital, she re-invests in merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shoes, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Letty Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Corrales en una localidad cercana a  la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, nos comentó que está casada, pero en los actuales momentos están separados por la distancia,  ya que su esposo esta fuera del país se encuentra en Venezuela,  está radicado  desde hace 2 años y tres meses.

Nuestra socia Mariana ha tenido que enfrentarse a situaciones bastante difíciles pero que con la ayuda de la Fundación ha podido salir adelante, se siente contenta porque sus padres la han apoyado junto a su hijo, en los actuales momentos nuestra socia sostiene un  negocio de comida, ha improvisado una área de la casa para poner un restaurante que atiende de lunes a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana y cierra una vez que termine todo lo preparado, para Mariana los días que mayor ingreso le dejan son los sábados y domingos, cuenta con clientes fijos que la buscan por su buen sazón y la forma que les atiende, esto ha hecho que por más de 4 años, esta trabajando sin ningún problema.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Mariana podrá invertir todo el dinero en su negocio, en abastecerse de los productos de primera necesidad como el arroz, legumbres  y carnes.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals) which meets in an area near the city of Montecristi in Manabí Province. She indicates that she is married, but at the moment she and her husband are separated by distance since he is in Venezuela and has been there for two years and three months.

Mariana has had to face difficult situations, but with the help of Fundación ESPOIR, she has been able to move forward. She feels happy because her parents have helped her raise her son. At the moment, she manages a food business. Mariana set aside an area in her house to establish a restaurant that she operates Monday through Sunday. From 8am until closing time, she prepares everything. Mariana generates the most revenue on Saturdays and Sundays. She has established customers who enjoy the good taste of her food and the service she provides. Her business has been in operation for more than four years and she has been working without any problems.

With this new loan, Sra. Mariana will be able to invest all of the money into her business. She plans to restock her inventory of basic necessities such as rice, legumes, and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, legumes, and meat

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Visitamos el Banco Comunal Los Corrales en la provincia de Manabí, localidad ubicada a pocos minutos de la ciudad  donde nació uno de los presidentes de nuestro país el viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro, en este lugar sus habitantes  se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadores  dedicados a diferentes actividades como; la venta de verduras, ebanistería y trabajos en tagua.

La señora Martha se dedica a la venta de comida tiene un restaurante en su propia casa, solo atiende los días sábados y domingos, lleva dos años con esta actividad, nos comentó que el esposos también tienen un negocio que es la venta de frutas  en un triciclo desde hace 10 años, hace su recorrido en el puerto de Manta y lo hace por sectores, cuentan con la ayuda de sus hijos que salen a vender con él, estos esposos llevan casados 40 años y sin ningún tipo de inconvenientes han sabido mantener su relación, nuestra socia Martha con este nuevo crédito podrá incrementar su negocio, comprando gallina criolla para preparar los platos típicos de la región además podrá compartir el crédito con el esposos para que surta el negocio de las frutas.
texts.en:
This is the “Los Corrales” communal bank, located in the Manabí province, a few minutes from the city where one of our country’s former presidents, Eloy Alfaro, was born. Here, the residents are hard working and dedicated to various activities, such as vegetable sales, cabinetmaking, and jewelry making. Martha sells food and has been running a restaurant out of her home for two years. It is only open on the weekends. She tells us that her husband also runs his own business, selling fruit from a three wheeled cycle, and has been doing so for ten years. He makes his run by sectors at the Manta port. They rely on their children’s help, who go out with him to make sales. They’ve been married for 40 years without any problems. Martha plans to use the money from this loan to grow her business. She will buy poultry to make dishes typical of the region. She will also share the loan with her husband, so that he can provide a greater assortment to his produce business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Neyci Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Neyci forma parte del banco comunal Los Corrales en una localidad ubicada en los bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi cuna del viejo Luchador Eloy Alfaro en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí, la señora Neyci mantienen una relación de 30 años con el padre de sus hijos, está dedicada a su hogar y a una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, apenas lleva 3 meses su negoció y le va muy bien, se siente contenta con él, por ello con este nuevo crédito podrá incrementarlo de frutas y víveres en general, todas las semanas le toca viajar hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar en los grandes mayoristas para que le quede algo de ganancias.

El esposo de la señora Neyci es chofer al igual que tiene un negocio de tagua considera que les va muy bien, ella empezó con su tienda vendiendo plátanos, queso y arroz y de a poco la ido surtiendo ahora ya es una tienda completa, desde las 6 de la mañana abre hasta las 6 de la tarde que cierra, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Neyci is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals) which meets in an area in the lower section of the city of Montecristi, the birthplace of the “Old Warrior” Eloy Alfaro (former Ecuadorian President). The city lies in the beautiful and fruitful province of Manabí. Sra. Neyci has maintained a relationship with the father of her children for 30 years. She is dedicated to managing her household and a small store that she has in her home. Her business has been open for three months and is doing very well. She feels happy with it and will use this new loan to increase her inventory of fruits and other general provisions. Every week she travels to the city of Manta and buys her products from the large wholesalers so that she will have a better profit margin.

Neyci’s husband works as a chauffeur and also runs a business processing “tagua” (a substitute for elephant ivory derived from palm nuts) which is doing very well. She started her store selling bananas, cheese, and rice, and then gradually increased her inventory until her store was complete. Her business opens at 6am and closes at 6pm. Neyci’s dream is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, oil, eggs, and fruit

loans.name: Nilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora  Nilda forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Corrales en una localidad situada en los bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi provincia de Manabí, nuestra socia lleva dos ciclos trabajando con los créditos de la Fundación, está dedicada a sus dos hijos pero también se da tiempo para cuidar de su negocio, ya son tres años que tienes una pequeña granja en su propia casa, compra los pollos en pie ya grandes luego los entrega a los súper mercador y tiendas por el sector donde vive, ella se encarga de faenarlos y pesarlos, le ha ido muy bien con su negocio se siente muy contenta con los resultados obtenido.

Nuestra socia se inicio en este negocio por  medio de su esposo ya que él trabaja en una granja, cuando se inicio hace 13 años la señora Nilda en su negocio lo hizo con poco dinero pero con el pasar del tiempo su negocio ha crecido, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en comprar un promedio de 40 pollos, segura esta que le dejara buenas ganancias con este nueva inversión, el sueño de la señora Nilda es hacer que su granja sea bien grande y a futuro tener su propio carro para trasladarse con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals) which meets in an area in the lower section of the city of Montecristi in Manabí Province. She has participated in two previous loan cycles with Fundación ESPOIR. Nilda is dedicated to her two children, but she also spends time looking after her business. For the past three years, she has managed a small farm at home. She buys chickens and then delivers them to the supermarkets and stores in the area where she lives. Nilda is in charge of butchering and weighing the birds. She has done very well with her business and feels very happy with the results she has achieved.

Nilda started this business since her husband already works on a farm that he established thirteen years ago. She had very little money, but over time her business has grown. With this new loan, she will invest all of it in the purchase of 40 chickens. Nilda is confident that she can generate good earnings from this new investment. She dreams of having a larger farm and owning a vehicle in the future so that she can travel to make her sales.
