Pour assurer ses besoins, Euphrasie mène comme activité la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (glacière, bols en séries, bassines, etc.) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Euphrasie vend des savons. Euphrasie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Euphrasie exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Euphrasie sollicite un deuxième prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
N. Euphrasie was born in 1985 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. She is married to HODONOU Julien, a chauffeur.  The couple have three children, some of whom are in school.  The family has been living for about ten years in PK10-Enafa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  Euphrasie, along with her husband, provides for her family with its various needs.  She did not attend school.  To support herself, she has a business going door-to-door selling kitchen utensils (insulated containers, nested bowls, tubs, etc.)  Secondarily, she sells soaps.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has been in this business for eight years and has already benefited from a loan from ALIDé that she has repaid.  Euphrasie is requesting a second loan to increase her inventory which will enable her to grow her sales. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils and soaps

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa B. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonisa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Leonisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Raliatou

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Banigbé au Bénin, S. Raliatou est mariée à TOSSOU Germain. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Raliatou s’est installée depuis cinq ans, à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Raliatou participe pleinement aux différentes charges de la famille. Raliatou n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Raliatou s’est mise à vendre des tissus et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à faire face à ses multiples charges. Raliatou se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Raliatou sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son capital et de rehausser le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Banigbé in Benin, Ms. S. Raliatou is married to Mr. TOSSOU Germain.  The couple have two children, who are both in school.  She settled five years ago in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where she lives with her husband and children.  She fully participates in meeting their various family expenses.  Raliatou did not attend school.  Eight years ago, she started selling cloth and shoes door-to-door.  This business generates the revenues for helping her to cope with multiple expenses.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the second time that Raliatou is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to bolster her capital and to raise up her level of business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and fabrics

loans.name: Member Good Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Member Good” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata S. (pictured on the left) is the leader of the group. She was born in Robuya Romende, in northern Sierra Leone, and is 35 years old. Aminata is married to a police officer and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For more than nineteen years now, Aminata has been selling ready-to-wear clothes for babies and children. She also sells baby-cosmetics such as powder, Vaseline, etc. With her share of this loan (SLL 1,000,000), Aminata will buy baby clothes and cosmetics for babies wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes and baby cosmetics wholesale for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is a 68 year old widow. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2006, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 61-year old married man from Lebanon. For 40 years, he has been running his own business in the construction industry. He is extremely proud of his experience and reputation. He says that his honesty and ability to interact well with people are some of his strengths. In his work, he completes all components of a construction project including installing the electrical wires and working on the pipes. 

He is requesting a loan of US $3000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to purchase rock and other materials for his construction projects. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua. In the future he hopes to buy a plot of land so he can construct a building.

loans.use: To purchase rock and other materials for his construction projects

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née en 1975, Y. Catherine est mariée à HODEHOU Faustin, un menuisier. Catherine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Catherine vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Sèkandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis six ans. Catherine subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux divers besoins de la famille. Catherine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Catherine prépare et vend de la nourriture (« akassa », fait à base de maïs ; riz ; accompagné de poissons et d’ailerons frits) à Sèkandji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Catherine achète ses produits. Catherine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Le premier prêt que Catherine  avait obtenu a été bien remboursé. La clientèle de Catherine s’accroît au jour le jour et Catherine n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire, en raison du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la forte demande de sa clientèle que Catherine sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Catherine Y. is married to Faustin Hodehou, a carpenter. Catherine is the mother of three children, all of whom are educated. Catherine has lived with her husband and children in the Sèkandji quarter, in the Sèmè-Podji,community, for six years. She and her husband support their family's diverse needs. Catherine did not go to school. To meet her needs, Catherine prepares and sells food ("akassa," made from a maize base, and rice with fried fish fin) in Sèkandji. Catherine buys her products In Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has done this work for eight years and is on her second loan with ALIDé. The first loan which Catherine received has been repaid in full. Catherine's clientele is growing everyday, and she can no longer satisfy them all due to lack of financial means. Thus, to strengthen her business and meet the strong demand of her clientele, Catherine is asking for a second loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, fish, fins, and condiments

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joseph K., an entrepreneur in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Joseph has applied for a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand his business. In his shop, right at the center of town, Joseph sells spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles.  

Joseph has been doing business for more than ten years now. However, his business has not been growing as planned due to the lack of sufficient capital. Joseph therefore applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to boost his business. With the help of this loan, he will buy spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles wholesale to add to his current inventory. In this way, Joseph expects to make better sales, more profit and consequently improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles wholesale for resale

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Sotchanhouè (Ganvié-Bénin), H. Rosette est mariée à DOHOU Soulé, un chauffeur. Rosette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Rosette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Ekpè III, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis cinq ans environs. Rosette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Rosette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Rosette s’est mise à vendre divers produits (sucre, farine de manioc, insecticides, boîtes d’allumettes, charbon de bois, etc.) à son domicile à Ekpè. Rosette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché d’Ikpinlè au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Rosette sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Sotchanhoué (Ganvié-Bénin), Rosette H. is married to Soulé DOHOU, a driver. Rosette is mother to three children, not all of whom are at school. Rosette has been living with her husband and children in Ekpé III in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for around five years. She helps her husband to cover the various household expenses from the income she earns from her business. Rosette did not got to school. Almost seven years ago she started selling various products (sugar, cassava flour, insecticides, boxes of matches, charcoal etc.) from her home in Ekpè. Rosette buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and also at the market in Ikpinlè in Benin. It is the first time that she has asked for financial support from ALIDé, so that she can strengthen her capital and increase her stock.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de divers produits (sucre, farine de manioc, allumettes, charbon de bois, etc.) Purchase of various products (sugar, cassava flour, matches, charcoal etc.)

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Née en 1988 à Cotonou, V. Victoire est mariée à TODJINOU Mesmin un enseignant. Le couple a deux enfants à charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Victoire vit depuis trois ans environs à Sekandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victoire vend depuis trois ans, des bois de chauffage à son domicile. Victoire achète ses produits à Pahou au Bénin. Victoire a bénéficié antérieurement d’un prêt de ALIDé, et l’a bien remboursé. Face à l’accroissement de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite un deuxième crédit, afin de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son stock de produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1988 in Cotonou, Victoire V. is married to Mesmin TODJINOU, a teacher. The couple has two children in its care, and both the children are at school. Victoire has lived with her children and husband for around three years in Sekandji in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. The couple shares responsibility for the various family expenses. Victoire did not go to school. For the past three years she has been selling firewood from her home. She buys her products in Pahou in Benin. Victoire has had one previous loan from ALIDé, which she repaid on time. In view of her growing customer base, she is requesting a second loan in order to strengthen her business and increase her stock.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year old married man from Lebanon with a family of four. For 12 years, he has been working as a blacksmith. Since 2007, he's rented a workshop where he's actively refined his skills in many kinds of metalwork including making furniture. He is proud of his competitive prices, honesty, experience, strong reputation, and high quality products. He notes that it has been a challenge to enter the market and to advertise effectively.

He is requesting a loan of US $1000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase more iron for his business. In the future, he hopes to open his own metal factory.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. A. is 24 year old single mother. She has four children between the ages of 3 months and 10 years old. A self-described 'visionary,' she owns a restaurant in Kariobangi that is a very busy market with many residential homes. She says business is good although there is a large number of similar businesses to hers therefore customers are spoiled for choice. 

In the future, she hopes to grow this business and provide external catering. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy foodstuffs to make more food to sell to the local people.

loans.use: To buy food stuff

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: H. Philomène est mariée à ZANNOUGBO Hervé, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis cinq ans au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Philomène aide son mari à subvenir aux divers besoins de sa famille. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Philomène vend des fagots de bois de chauffage à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de se faire de revenu l’aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne à Pahou, au Bénin. Philomène a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui avait permis de rehausser un peu le niveau de son activité. Philomène sollicite un deuxième prêt, pour agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Philomène H. is married to Hervé ZANNOUGBO, a mechanic. They have two children, both in school. The family settled five years ago in the Agbalilamè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Philomène helps her husband deal with the family’s various needs. Philomène has not attended school. She sells bundles of firewood from her home, which generates revenue that helps her meet the needs of her family. She gets her supplies from Pahou, in Benin. Philomène has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which enabled her to increase somewhat her level of activity. She is now requesting a second loan, to further expand her activity and increase customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of frozen foods for resale

loans.name: Biléyor

texts.en: This woman sells maize and other cereals out of her home. She has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA in order to purchase sacks of grain and pay for their transportation. She started her business in 2007. The income she receives helps her to raise her only child on her own. This is her first micro-loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of grain

loans.name: Cheikh Abdoul Aziz Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEIKH ABDOUL AZIZ est l'un des huit groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE. Elle sont onze (11) femmes issues toutes du même quartier et ont formé le groupe par affinité depuis trois ans et demi. Elles sont d'âges différents variant de 30 à 45 ans, mariées et mères d'au moins 3 enfants. C'est groupe très soudé et dynamique et participe activement au différentes activités du Banc Villageois qui sont les réunions mensuelles, les réunions de remboursement, les rencontres de sensibilisation et autres.
leur activité principale est le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, d'encens, de produits cosmétiques etc...

Quant à la présidente du groupe Madame Ndack T., à l'extrême droit de la photo, en voile blanc sur la tête et sac à main accroché à son épaule est âgée de 52 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses deux enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de montres, d'encens, de foulards, d'écharpes et de voiles. Elle s'approvisionne en Mauritanie, un pays frontalier du Sénégal, pour revendre son produit dans le quartier. Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir mené depuis au moins trois ans. Et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises. Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et d'assurer les études universitaires d'un de ses enfants en année de licence.
texts.en:
The solidarity group CHEIKH ABDOUL AZIZ is one of the eight groups that make up the 'Banc Villageois' of DIAMAGUENE. The group is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood and who formed a group because of their common interests three and a half years ago. Their ages vary between 30 and 45 and they are married and the mothers of at least three children. This is a very close and dynamic group who participate actively in the various activities of the Banc Villageois, monthly meetings, meetings to repay loans, training sessions, etc. Their main business is selling clothing, incense, cosmetics, etc. As for the president of the group, Mrs. Ndack T., on the far right in the photo with a white head covering and handbag on her shoulder, she is 52, a widow, and lives with her two children. She sells watches, incense, head scarves, shawls, and veils. She buys her goods in Mauritania, a country which borders Senegal, and sells them in her neighborhood. She has a lot of experience in her business, having been in it for at least three years. Her new loan will allow her to expand her inventory. Her goal is to support her children and pay educational expenses for her child who is finishing university this year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the working capital of the solidarity group

loans.name: Bendictus

texts.en:
Bendictus A. K. is 38 years old and married. They do not have any children yet. His business, known by the name Dragon Accessories, is located near a bus stop in a residential area in Nairobi. He has been selling mobile-phone accessories, like SIM cards, chargers, headphones, mobile batteries and mobile-phone covers, to the local people of Kariobangi for the last six years. He says the business is very profitable, although at times there is unavailability of some items. 

He is using his loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more phone accessories to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to move to the city center where there is more business. He describes himself as respectful and aggressive.

loans.use: Phone accessories

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé A. est une femme âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Atakpamé, une ville située à 100 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse des produits de l’alimentation générale et elle exerce cette activité il y a 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché d’Atakpamé  chez les grossistes, avec ce crédit, elle voudrait augmenter le stock de marchandise dans sa boutique en achetant en gros afin que le prix unitaire lui soit moins cher et qu’elle puisse réalisée d’énormes bénéfices. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, elle souhaiterait subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Amélé A., 45, is married and the mother of five children. She lives in Atakpamé, a town situated 100 km from Kpalimé. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for 10 years. She buys her inventory in the big marketplace of Atakpamé from wholesalers, and with this loan she would like to add to the stock of merchandise in her shop by buying wholesale, so that the unit price of her goods will be lower and she will be able to make enormous profit. With this profit, she would like to support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 50-year-old manufacturer of metal products.  He primarily makes metal basins and frying pans, which he sells from his shop opposite a busy street near a junction heading to the market area. He has been in this business for 25 years and has five employees. Joseph is married and has six children, four boys and two girls. The primary business challenges that he faces are competition and the high prices of raw materials.

Joseph plans to use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional raw materials such as drums and metal sheets. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Joseph hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house so that he can retire and do some farming.  In five years, he dreams of opening another branch elsewhere to continue expanding his income.

Joseph describes himself as hardworking, industrious, dedicated and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials such as drums and metal sheets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48-year-old “matatu” owner. Matatus are privately owned, 14-passenger vans used extensively throughout Kenya for public transportation.  They drive a specific route each day to pick up and drop off pay-as-you-go passengers along the way.

He has been in this business for 20 years and has two employees. Joseph is married and has three sons, who range in age from 17 to 24 years old. 

The primary business challenges that he faces are vehicle breakdown/maintenance and police harassment. In addition to his matatu business, Joseph also has a tea-leaf farm and a dairy cow and he grows bananas and maize.

Joseph plans to use the 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to pay for vehicle maintenance and farm supplies.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Joseph hopes to buy a minibus. In five years, he dreams of owning many vehicles.

Joseph describes himself as a good mechanic who is hardworking and business-minded.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance and farm supplies

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie E. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old. Annalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annalie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annalie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Annalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annalie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 45 year-old box manufacturer. She makes boxes to sell to clients on a busy highway near a junction leading to the market place. She has been in this business for 16 years. Hellen is married and has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls. The primary business challenge she faces is competition.

Hellen plans to use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase materials to make boxes. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Hellen hopes to have a good family where all her children will be educated and also that she will have enough money to take care of her family. In 5 years, she dreams that she will own big stalls in several places where she will have many customers and boost her income.

Hellen describes herself as hardworking, industrious, generous, ambitious, God-fearing, and intelligent.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make boxes

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio L. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old. Aurelio is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aurelio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years now.

Aurelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelio is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurelio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, CEVI has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
35-year-old Chona P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years already.

Chona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, N. Véronique est mariée à AGOUNLA Théophile, un gendarme à la retraite. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Véronique s'est installée à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Véronique est une revendeuse ambulante de sachets depuis cinq ans environs. Véronique s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Benin. C’est la première fois que Véronique sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin de renforcer son capital ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux besoinx de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, N. Véronique is married to AGOUNLA Théophile, a retired policeman. The couple has three children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Véronique settled in Ekpè in the township of Sèmè-Podji, about seven years ago, with her children and her husband. The couple share in supporting their family. Véronique never went to school. She has been walking around the town selling bags for about five years. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. This is the first time that Véronique is requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow her working capital. This will allow her to better cater for the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags for resale

loans.name: Constant

texts.en:
Constant is a 30-year-old and heads a family of seven people of whom five are his children. He has a retail shop in Kibaale, Uganda which he has operated for the last six years. The major dream for his family is education for his children. He sells home consumables and also sells dry foods like maize and beans. 

Like in most parts of Uganda, Constant and his wife are also farmers which, he says, helps increase the family income. This is Constant’s first loan from Hofokam Limited, having got to know about it through a village mate. The purpose of the loan is to buy salt, sugar, soap, beans, and maize for selling.

loans.use: buying sugar, salt, soap, beans, maize for resale

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and tomatoes to sell.

Cicilia is 47 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and only her younger child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her younger child to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Augustine

texts.fr: I. Augustine  est née le 01 Septembre 1966 à Porto-Novo capitale administrative du BENIN. Augustine est mariée à KINTOHOUAN Emmanuel un transitaire. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Kpakpakanmè un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, depuis sept ans. Augustine subvient avec son mari aux différents besoins de la famille. Augustine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Augustine  mène comme activité la vente des produits vivriers et des céréales (maïs, mil, haricot, soja, etc.) depuis dix ans. Augustine s’approvisionne à HOUEGBO, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin. Augustine  sollicite un premier  prêt auprès de ALIDé  pour augmenter son  capital et en même temps son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux divers besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
I. Augustine was born on September 01, 1966 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of BENIN. She is married to KINTOHOUAN Emmanuel, a forwarding agent. The couple have five children, all enrolled in school. They have been living in Kpakpakanmè, a district of the town of Cotonou, for seven years. Augustine helps her husband support their family. Augustine never went to school. To support herself, she has been selling groceries and cereals (maize, millet, dried beans, soybeans, etc.) for 10 years. She buys her goods at HOUEGBO, a foodstuffs market in Bénin. Augustine is requesting her first ever loan from ALIDé to grow her working capital and at the same time, her stock of goods, which will allow her to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals (maize, dried beans, soybeans, millet, etc.)

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin P., 45 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is married and has a 26-year-old child. To make a living, Edwin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edwin from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice H is currently in the business of selling bags of shorgum and maize at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize to sell.  Alice is 49 years old and is widowed.   She has six children. Her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Monsieur Djiby D. est un commerçant  de 54 ans qui habite dans la localité de Baye Laye plus précisément  dans le quartier de Ndiareme a Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre 2009 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. C’est un soutien de famille, marie et père de2 enfants de17 et 22 ans, ayant 4 autres personnes à sa charge. Par conséquent monsieur D. évolue  dans le secteur du petit commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. C’est une activité  qu’il a choisi par passion et aussi a cause de son aspect lucratif. Il sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour acheter du mil, du mais, de l’arachide et d’autres  denrées  qui peuvent être écoulées sur le marche. Il n’a pas de place fixe dans le marche, mais des son retour de voyage il place automatiquement ses produits à ses clients. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices  de 35000frs par semaine et par voyage. L’augmentation de ses gains lui permettra  de résoudre  ses problèmes de loyer et de mieux assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mr. Djiby D. is a 54-year old businessman who lives in the town of Baye Laye, more precisely in the Ndiareme district of Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye savings institution since November 2009 and has already had one loan. He supports his family, is married and father to two children of 17 and 22 years old; he also has responsibility for four other people. As a result Mr. D. has been developing a small business for over 20 years. It is an activity he chose out of love and also because of its lucrative aspect. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy millet, corn, peanut and other food products which can be sold on the market. He has no fixed place in the market but when he gets back from his travels he places his products immediately with his customers. This loan will allow him to increase his profits by 35,000 francs per week and per trip. The increase in his earnings will allow him to resolve his rent problems and manage his daily expenses better.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of working capital

loans.name: Sakaria

texts.en:
Sakaria is a 38 year-old clothing merchant.  He sells shirts and shoes for both men and women in a local marketplace.  He has been in this business for 12 years and has one other employee.  Sakaria is married and has three children; two boys and one girl aged from 6 to 15 years old. 

The primary business challenges that he faces are low sales due to competition, intermittent bad weather, and local regulations. Before selling clothes, he was a tailor.
 
Sakaria plans to use the 60,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of shoes and shirts that are in fashion with the hope of increasing his sales.

In the future, Sakaria hopes to increase his sales enough to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of shoes and shirts to sell

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: D. Véronique est née en 1970 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à KAKPO Razack, un chauffeur, Véronique est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, un enfant est à la charge du couple. Il y a environs quatre ans que Véronique s'est installée à Ekpè III dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec son mari et son enfant. Véronique vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille. Véronique n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis sept ans environs, Véronique vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Véronique souhaite augmenter le volume de son activité et ne plus connaître de rupture de stock ; raison pour laquelle Véronique sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Veronique D. was born in 1970 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé prefecture. She is married to Razack Kakpo, a driver, and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Only one of the children is in the couple’s care. About four years ago, Veronique settled in Ekpé III in the community of Sèmè-Podji, with her husband and child. Veronique helps her husband take care of the family budget. She never went to school. For about seven years she has been selling firewood from her home. This business allows her to take care of her needs. She would like to boost her business and avoid running out of stock, which is why she is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing firewood

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 30 year-old metal worker.  He primarily makes metal gutters for customers in the surrounding area.  He has been in this business for eight years and has three employees. Festus is married; his wife is a tailor.   The primary business challenge he faces is competition.

Festus plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase iron sheets and other metal for his business.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, Festus hopes to own a big piece of land and build on it.  In five years, he dreams of having many workers and being a famous supplier of his products and materials.

Festus describes himself as intelligent, hardworking, and committed.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and other metal for his business

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismaila S. est un retraite de 64 ans qui habite dans le quartier de KIP COCO à Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis février 2005. Il a déjà rembourse 4 crédits antérieurs. Pour mieux  gérer sa retraite il a choisi de s’adonner à l’aviculture pour commercialiser des poulets de chair. Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour augmenter le nombre de ses sujets afin de parvenir à éviter les ruptures dans la vente et faire face aux pénuries. Ses gains financiers lui permettent de gérer  les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ismaila S. is a retired man of 64 years of age, who lives in the neighborhood of KIP COCO in Guediawaye. He is a member of the Baye Laye fund since February 2005. He obtained already four previous loans, all fully repaid. To better live his retirement he chose to get involved in poultry farming and sell broilers. Mr. S. requests a loan of 300,000 francs to increase the number of chickens so they will always be available for sale and he will be able to face sortage. With the profit he will take care of the needs of his family and pay school tuition for his children.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: M. Béatrice est née en 1975 à Avrankou, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à HODONOU Félix, Béatrice est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais un des enfants n'est plus à la charge du couple. Il y a six ans environs que Béatrice vit avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Béatrice aide son mari à assurer les différentes charges familiales. Béatrice n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, activité qu'elle exerce de façon secondaire. Béatrice exerce comme activité principale, la vente de bois de chauffage à son domicile, depuis huit ans environs. C'est dans les forêts à Sèmè-Podji que Béatrice s'approvisionne. Béatrice  souhaite renforcer son capital et augmenter le volume de son activité ; raison pour laquelle Béatrice sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Béatrice M. was born in 1975 in Avrankou, in the Ouémé region. Married to Félix Hodonou, Béatrice is the mother of six children, all educated. One of the children is no longer under the couple's care. Béatrice and her family have lived for about six years in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community. She helps her husband to support their family. Béatrice never went to school, but she learned to sew, work she does as a second source of income. As her principal business, Béatrice has sold firewood from her home for about eight years. She gets her supply in the forests of Sèmè-Podji. She wishes to increase her capital funds and the volume of her business. She is why she is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 45 year-old owner of a kiosk.  She sells items such as milk, bread, cooking oil, flour, body oil, etc. to nearby residents.  She has been in this business for eight years.  Milka is married and has five children; two boys and three girls, aged from 10 to 28 years old. 

The primary business challenges she faces are low sales due to the low income of her customers, plus a high electricity bill for the refrigerator in her kiosk.

Milka plans to use the 60,000 KES loan to boost the stock of bread, milk, cooking oil, flour, etc. in the hope of increasing her income.

In the future, Milka hopes to expand her business to accommodate other products required by her customers.  In five years, she dreams of being the leading supplier of the products she sells to the surrounding residential area.

Milka describes herself as determined, hopeful, honest, and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of goods for sale

loans.name: El Limon Flat Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA EL LIMON YA QUE FUE EL PRIMER NOMBRE QUE SALIO PARA QUE SE LLAMARA SU GRUPO, LAS CUATRO INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON FRANCISCA S., REFUGIO C., JUANA G. Y MA ESPERANZA C. ELLAS SE DEDICAN: FRANCISCA  ALA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR MENUDEO, REFUGIO ELABORA CUEDROS PARA VENDER, JUANA VENDE BUÑUELOS,DONAS EN LAS NOCHES Y MA ESPERANZA QUIERE VENDER COMIDA LOS FINES DE SEMANA.

LA SRA FRANCISCA S. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO ELLA ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS DE 20, 17 Y 12 AÑOS DE EDAD FRANCISCA QUIERE DEDICARSE A SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ASI PUEDE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA ELLA ESTA SEGURA DE QUE LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y HUARACHES ES UN BUEN NEGOCIO YA QUE SE IRA A VENDER A LAS PLAZAS DE LOS PUEBLOS ALEDAÑOS DE SU COMUNIDAD YA QUE VA GENTE DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y NO LE GUSTA DAR CARO.

CON ESTE CREDITO VA A COMPRAR HUARACHES DE LEON GUANAJUATO, ZAPATOS, BOTAS, CHANCLAS, ETC. SU META PARA UN FUTURO ES TENER UN GRAN NEGOCIO Y TENER MUCHOS CLIENTES PARA ASI UN DIA PODER SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE Y PODERLES DAR UNA CARRERA.

DOÑA FRANCISCA NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA SE SIENTE MUY AFORTUNADA DE QUE LE HAYAN PODIDO DAR EL CREDITO YA QUE DESDE CUANDO TENIA MUCHAS GANAS DE ENTRAR A ESTA FINANCIERA YA QUE LE HABIAN COMENTADO DE SU INTERES BAJO Y LA SERIEDAD CON LA QUE TRABAJAN Y AHORA QUE SE ESTAN UNIENDO CON UNA NUEVA EMPRESA ESPERAN QUE LAS SIGAN APOYANDO Y POR PARTE DE ELLAS ASEGURAN QUE NO VAN A QUEDAR MAL.

POR ULTIMO AGRADECE A KIVA Y FUNDACION REALIDAD POR AYUDARLAS PARA SACAR SUS NEGOCIOS ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Limon” (The Lime) since that was the first name they thought of to call themselves. The four members of the group are Francisca S., Refugio C., Juana G., and Ma Esperanza C.. Their business activities are as follows: Francisca sells shoes at retail; Refugio creates paintings to sell; Juana sells fritters and donuts in the evenings; and Ma Esperanza wants to sell food on the weekends.

Sra. Francisca S. is a member of the group. She is married and has three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). Francisca wants to concentrate on her business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She is confident that selling shoes and sandals is a good business and plans to offer her products in the main squares of the surrounding villages in her community. The people who live there have limited resources, so she does not want to sell anything expensive.

Francisca will use her loan to buy sandals, shoes, boots, flip-flops, and other items in Leon Guanajuato. Her goal for the future is to have a great business and many customers so that one day her children can get ahead and earn a degree.

Doña Francisca says she feels very fortunate to have been granted a loan. She wanted to pursue financing due to the low interest and because she is serious about her business. Now that she is part of a new group of ladies, she hopes that they will continue receiving support and work together so that they do not fail.

Finally, she thanks Kiva and Fundación Realidad for helping them move their businesses forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals, shoes, boots, flip-flops, and other types of footwear

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, D. Elisabeth est mariée à AKPLOGAN Thomas, un chauffeur. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais un des enfants n'est plus à leur charge. Elisabeth vit avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis neuf ans. Elisabeth apporte une aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Elisabeth n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Elisabeth prépare et vend de la nourriture ("akassa" fait à base d'amidon de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce aux poissons et de viande) à son domicile. Elisabeth se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elisabeth exerce cette activité depuis douze ans environs. C'est la première fois que Elisabeth sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Elisabeth D. is married to Thomas Akplogan, a driver. The couple has six children, all of whom are educated. One of the children is no longer under the couple's care. Elizabeth has lived with her family in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for nine years. Elisabeth helps her husband to assure that their family's needs are met. Elisabeth did not go to school. To meet her needs, Elisabeth prepares and sells food ("akassa" made from a maize starch base, and rice with fish and meat) from her home. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Elisabeth has done this work for about twelve years. This is the first time Elisabeth is asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and better meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, fish, rice, meat and condiments

loans.name: El Retoño Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Retoño” nombrado así por que antes era un restarurant granD. y ahora solo es una pequeño palapa hecha D. madera y laminas en los camellones chontales D. Nacajuca, en el Estado D. Tabasco. Está integrado por tres hombres y una mujer. Los representa  Martín B. H., es soltero, además D. ser socio del pequeño restaurant también trabaja D. vigilante por las noches. Timoteo B. H. tiene 2 hijos y trabaja en el restaurant y en un hotel D. L. ciudad D. Villahermosa. Martha B. H. hermana D. Timoteo, se dedica atender el negocio y Víctor Manuel B. D. L. C. que tiene 1 hijo, también se dedica a trabajar en una tienda comercial además del restaurant. 

Timoteo, con su esposa y dos hijos, decidieron retomar el trabajo que se hacia en los camellones chontales, que son extensiones D. tierra “ganada” a las lagunas. El grupo, solicita el crédito para comprar material para construir baños y remodelar el local (cemento, block, arena) y comprar ingredientes para L. elaboración D. sus platillos como: cokteles, ensaladas D. camarón, tortillas, etc. Y dar mantenimiento a L. alberca. Sueñan con tener una buena infraestructura, más sillas, mesas para acondicionar mejor el lugar y ofrecer así un mejor servicio a los clientes D. los municipios D. Nacajuca, Comalcalco, cunduacan, Villahermosa e incluso del país. Poner más palapas, cabañas y juegos infantiles. 

Son un grupo entusiasta, muy unidos, emprendedores con deseos D. superarse y tener un  negocio rentable y ofrecer un buen servicio D. restaurant,  es un grupo solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Están muy contentos por L. ayuda que  le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA al creer en ellos y otorgarles un crédito que les servirá para invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “El Retoño” is named after a large restaurant that previously existed, but is now housed in a small palapa hut maD. of wood and metal sheeting located on a Chontal reservation in the State of Tabasco. The members consist of three men and one woman. Martín B. H. is the group representative. He is single and a partner of this small restaurant, but he also works at night as a security guard. Timoteo B. H. has two children and works at the restaurant and also at a hotel in the city of Villahermosa. Martha B. H. is Timoteo’s sister and manages the business. Víctor Manuel B. D. L. C. has one child and works at a retail store in addition to working at the restaurant.

Timoteo, along with his wife and two children, decided to reopen the restaurant upon acquiring some tracts of land near the lake. The group is requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, blocks, and sand) for building bathrooms and remodeling the entire structure as well as purchase ingredients for preparing dishes such as cocktails, shrimp salads, tortillas, and other items. The swimming pool will also be maintained. They dream of having a solid infrastructure plus additional chairs and tables so that they can proviD. a nicer atmosphere and better service to their customers who come from the towns of Nacajuca, Comalcalco, Cunduacan, Villahermosa, and other parts of the country. In addition, they hope to install more palapa stations, cabanas, and children’s games.

They are a very close and enthusiastic group. These entrepreneurs desire to succeed, have a profitable business, and offer good service in their restaurant. The members of this solidarity group have known each other for many years.

They are glad to have the assistance of Fundación Realidad and Kiva and are grateful for the belief in them by providing this loan so that they can invest in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for remodeling, ingredients, and pay for pool maintenance

loans.name: Selvina

texts.en:
Selvina is a married woman with two children, 1 girl in secondary school and 1 boy in primary school. Her husband is employed. She sells charcoal to her neighbors and passersby.

Selvina has been running the business for five years and before she was unemployed. With the KES 80,000 loan, she wants to add more stock of charcoal and start selling coconuts at a wholesale price.

Her main business challenge is coping with harassment from the tax collectors. She would like to build her own house in future as she currently lives in a rented home with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She decided to join Yehu so as to access loans for her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: Buy 80 sacks of charcoal and 800 coconuts

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: T. Georgette est née le 22 Avril 1972 et est mariée à AZONGBE Casimir, un pêcheur. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Georgette vit depuis une dizaine d'année à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Georgette n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de huit ans que Georgette mène comme activité, la vente de céréales (haricot, maïs, riz, mil, soja, etc.), ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Georgette achète ses produits au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. C'est la première fois que Georgette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son capital et d'élever davantage le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
Georgette T. was born in 1972 and is married to Casimir Azongbe, a fisherman. The couple has four children who are all educated. Georgette has lived for 12 years in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community, with her husband and children. Together, the couple assures that the family's needs are met. Georgette did not go to school. Nearly eight years ago, Georgette began selling cereals (beans, maize, rice, millet, soy). This work allows her to support her family. Georgette buys her products in Houègbo in Bénin. This is the first time that Georgette is asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her working capital and further increase the level of her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals (beans, maize, rice, millet, soy)

loans.name: Alexandre Samuel

texts.pt:
Alexandre Samuel T. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 10, 08, 07 e 02 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 1ą classe não continuou porque os pais priorizaram que ele cuidasse do gado da família. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane com os seus pais ha 20 anos, devido a guerra de desestabilização. É negociante ha mais de 4 anos e trabalha também na empresa Aguas de Moçambique como guarda. A sua esposa também possui um negócio e tem ajudado seu marido. Não possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.200.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, óleo, sal e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na construção de outro estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Alexandre Samuel T. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children, ages 10, 8, 7 and 2. The three oldest children go to school. Alexandre only finished first grade; he did not continue with school because his parents felt it was more important for him to take care of the family's cattle. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. 20 years ago, Alexandre left Chibuto to move to Boane District with his family because of the civil war. He has been a businessman for more than four years and also works as a guard for Aguas de Moçambique. His wife also has a job and has helped Alexandre. He has no employees and has an income of about 7,000 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and saves some of it through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Alexandre has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This 10,200 meticais loan is his first. He intends to buy products (rice, sugar, oil, salt and other items) to increase his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain his good credit. In the future, Alexandre would like to apply for loans to build another shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (rice, oil, sugar, salt, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20 year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a house painter since 2006. He works independently as a painter and travels to meet his clients. In Lebanon, it is often necessary for young people to work to help support the family with the increasing cost of living in the country. He and one parent work to support the household.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his work. He is requesting a loan of $1,000. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his work as a painter

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Née en 1958 à Missérété au Bénin, H. Cécile vit depuis trente ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Cécile est mariée à un certain Justin. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement trois des enfants sont à la charge de Cécile et de son mari. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses trois enfants à charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Cécile n'a pas été à l'école. C'est depuis trente ans que Cécile prépare et vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Cécile gère un moulin à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria que Cécile achète ses produits. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, Cécile sollicite pour une première fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Missérété in Bénin, Cécile H. has lived for 30 years in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community. Cécile is married to Justin. The couple has seven children, all of whom are educated. Only three of the children are still under the couple's care. Cécile lives with her husband and the three children. Together, the couple supports the family's different needs. Cécile did not go to school. For 30 years, she has prepared and sold "akassa" (a local dish made from a base of maize starch) from her home. As secondary work, Cécile manages a mill from her home. She purchases her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and in Nigeria. With the goal of strengthening her working capital and increasing her stock, Cécile is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of maize

loans.name: Argentina Jotassone

texts.pt:
Argentina Jotassone Mariquele nasceu na cidade de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 21 e 20 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Frequenta 6ą classe no curso nocturno porque na altura não teve oportunidade de continuar devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Xai xai para Maputo sozinha com objectivo de vir residir com a irmã. Mais tarde casou se e fixou sua residência em Boane. Tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve ha mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.900.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleiras e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um aviário e iniciar actividade de venda de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Argentina Jotassone M. was born in the city of Xai-xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, married and has two children who are 21 and 20 years old. The younger child goes to school. Argentina is attending 6th grade night school classes because she became pregnant while very young and was unable to finish school. She lives in her own house with her family and supports a nephew who lives with her. She left Xai-xai by herself to move to Maputo so she could live with her sister. Later she married and made her home in Boane. Argentina has had her own business for more than two years. She has no employees and has an income of about 7,900 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account at Millenium Bim. She has never had loans from other banks. Argentina learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her first loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais. She intends to buy construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items) to continue construction on her house. Argentina promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. In the future she intends to apply for loans to build a chicken coop and start selling broiler chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39 year old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and one sibling. Two other members of her household also work to support the family. She has been renting a shop where she sells clothes since 2004. She has more than 15 years of experience in the sales field. 

She is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  She plans to use the loan to increase her store’s inventory. She will bring new merchandise from Turkey. Many entrepreneurs sell clothes and blankets from Turkey because it is close in proximity and known for its high quality of goods. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering microloans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris Del Socorro tiene 44 años, tiene 3 hijos, como Madre responsable cuida de ellos. Su actividad es la venta refrescos y golosinas, además de tener este negocio se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio así podrá obtener más ganancias para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris Del Socorro, 44, has 3 children, and as a responsible mother she cares for them. She sells soft drinks and sweets, and also has a business selling cosmetics. She does all this because she is always seeking out ways to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her business. She hopes to improve her business so that she can obtain higher earnings and make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 4 Group

texts.en:
Johanny is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple, wooden structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Johanny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia (fantasy), a small variety shop aimed at women, by purchasing six pairs of pants, skirts, blouses and shoes to sell.

Johanny will use the profits to invest in her home, by replacing wooden walls with concrete block, an important improvement in the termite-infested and hurricane-prone Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, women's shoes and skirts to sell

loans.name: Carolina Salvador

texts.pt:
Carolina D. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 49 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de 26, 26, 22, 14, 11 e 07 anos de idade, destes 4 apenas vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe e neta que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, trabalha como docente ha mais de 11 anos e do Quadro do Ministério da Educação não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.500.00mt por que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, chapas de zinco, cimento e outros) para terminar a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir dependências para aluguer.
texts.en:
Carolina D. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is a 49-year-old widow and has six children who are 26, 26, 22, 14, 11 and 7 years old. Four of the children go to school. Carolina only finished sixth grade and did not continue school because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother and granddaughter who live with her. She has never left her hometown. For more than 11 years, Carolina has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education. She has no employees and has a salary of 4,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some of this money in her bank account. She has never had loans from other banks and learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is Carolina's third loan. She is asking for 10,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, zinc sheets, cement and other items) to finish building her house. Carolina promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain her credit. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to build rooms for rent.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (sand, stone, zinc sheets, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 30-year-old shopkeeper. He owns a shop where he sells consumer products to walk-in customers and has been in this business for six years. He is married and has two sons from 2 to 5 years old.

The primary business challenge Antony faces is competition from nearby shops. In addition to his shop, Antony also does some farming from which he sells maize and beans for additional income. Before he was a shopkeeper, he worked in a barber shop.

Antony plans to use the 80,000 KES loan to purchase additional inventory for his shop. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 KES.

In the future, Antony hopes to buy his own plot of land in a nearby town. In five years, he dreams of living in his own home.

Antony describes himself as an outgoing family man.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for his shop

loans.name: Sydonie

texts.fr: A. Sydonie est née en 1976 à Ifangni, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ALETEDJANON Paulin, Sydonie est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Sydonie vit avec son mari et ses enfants à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis huit ans environs. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Sydonie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Sydonie  prépare et vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile, et de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Sydonie vend de l'huile de palme. Sydonie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. Sydonie exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et par ricochet sa production, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sydonie sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sydonie A. was born in 1976 in Ifangni, in the Ouémé region. Married to Paulin Aletedjanon, Sydonie is the mother of six children, all of whom are educated. Sydonie has lived with her husband and children in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community, for about eight years. Together, the couple supports the family. Sydonie did not go to school. To meet her needs, she prepares and sells "akassa" (a local dish made from a maize starch base) from her home and door-to-door. As secondary work, she sells palm oil. Sydonie stocks up on supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and also at the market of Houègbo in Bénin. Sydonie has done this work for seven years. With the goal of increasing her working capital and increasing production, thus better satisfying her clientele, Sydonie is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of maize and barrels of palm oil.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 27-year-old box manufacturer.  He makes boxes for people in a busy market area and sells to people in town and even outside of the country.  He has been in this business for 6 years and has 3 employees. 

Charles plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture boxes.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, he hopes to have a much bigger business where he can accommodate all his customers’ requirements.  In 5 years, he dreams of being self-sufficient with a much higher income.

Charles describes himself as hard-working, industrious, determined, and someone who is focused to attain his goals.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture boxes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 47-year-old welder.  He primarily welds door frames, window frames, chairs, and beds.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has 3 employees.  James is married and has 8 children, from 12 to 20 years old. 

The primary business challenges he faces are fewer customers than he would like, clients with low incomes, and his high electricity bills.  Before his welding business, he worked in a battery-charging business.

James plans to use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase raw materials for his welding business (iron rods, wire and welding rods, hacksaw blades, etc.)
 
In the future, James hopes to be able to access more capital so he can sell finished products and open a workshop to teach others, especially orphans.  In 5 years, he dreams of employing more workers, expanding the workshop, and producing a wider variety of products.

James describes himself as hard-working, determined, honest, and patient.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his welding business

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi M. N. is sixty-two years old. He is married and has seven children who are already adults. He engages in furniture making. Apart from that he also sells eggs, charcoal and cookers. He has been in this business for the last ten years and has four employees. 

Mwangi says the business is good but he has financial constraints and that is why he wants to borrow Kes 40,000 to add more materials for making furniture and the cookers. In furture, he hopes to expand his business and acquire property. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: materials for furniture and cookers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has been working as a farmer since 2005 and he has over 7 years of experience in the agricultural industry. He lives with his parents and two siblings. Both he and one parent work to support the household.
