He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplies for his farm such as fertilizer. He is requesting a loan of US$ 2000. This will be his second Kiva loan. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva lenders to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm such as fertilizer

loans.name: Jhonson Paco

texts.es:
Jhonson tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de La Florida, un distrito de la sierra norte del país, pertenece a la provincia de San Miguel de la región Cajamarca, se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a la fabricación de muebles, puertas y sillas en madera, el tiene un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio donde confecciona sus productos para luego venderlos en diversos mercados de la zona norte del país, adicionalmente también elabora sus productos en base a pedidos, esta actividad es la unica mediante la cual percibe ingresos, por este motivo trata de mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Jhonson desea equipar su taller con una máquina cortadora, adquiriendo este equipo podrá mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos y también los realizará con mayor facilidad, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Jhonson es una persona que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar su negocio adelante, con las ganancias que percibe el sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia. En la zona el es conocido por su trabajo y por la responsabilidad con la que lo realiza.
texts.en:
Jhonson is 42 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents and siblings in the disctrict of La Florida, a district in the northern mountains of the country. This district belongs to the province of San Miguel in the region of Cajamarca. La Florida is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past eight years, he has been building wooden furniture, doors and chairs. He has a small workshop in his home where he makes his products to sell later at different markets in the northern region of the country. Additionally, he also manufactures products based on orders. This activity is the only means by which he makes income. For this reason, he tries to maintain his business in the best way possible. Jhonson wants to equip his workshop with a cutting machine. Purchasing this equipment could improve the quality of his work and would allow him to carry it out more easily. To achieve this objective, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles (2000 PEN). Jhonson is a person that always gives his best to move his business forward. With his earnings, he supports himself and helps support his family. In the area, he is known for his work and for the responsible nature with which he performs it.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cutting machine for a workshop to build wooden furniture.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa B. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Luisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: H. Félicienne est née vers 1968 au BENIN et est mariéé à AGUINDE Samuel un chauffeur. Félicienne vit à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-kpodji depuis onze ans. Félicienne est mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés dont cinq sont à sa charge. Félicienne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Félicienne mène comme activité la vente de fournitures scolaires (bic, cahier, ardoise, crayon, chiffon, craie etc.)et des sachets au marché de son quartier depuis vingt deux ans. Félicienne s'approvisionne au grand marché international du Benin qu'est Dantokpa. Félicienne a déja bénéficié quatre fois de concours financiers auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. Pour renforcer toujours son activité et pour faire face aux besoins existants de sa clientèle, Félicienne souhaite renouveller un nouveau Prêt.
texts.en:
Félicienne H. was born in 1968 in Benin and is married to Samuel Aguinde, a driver. Félicienne has lived in Sekandji in the Seme-kpodji community for 11 years. Félicienne is married and mother of seven children, all of whom are educated. Five of them are still under her care. Félicienne never went to school. To help her husband, Félicienne has sold school supplies (pens, notebooks, slates, pencils, erasers, chalk, etc.) and bags at the market in her quarter for 20 years. She buys her supplies at the international market of Bénin in Dantokpa. Félicienne has already benefited from four ALIDé loans which she has repaid. In order to continue to strengthen her business and meet the existing needs of her clients, Félicienne wishes to receive a new loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies (notebooks, pens, pencils, slates, erasers, etc) and bags

loans.name: La Fuerza 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group La Fuerza (the force), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple, rented structure with her husband and three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling water and ice by purchasing a freezer to keep her wares cold. She will use the profits to save towards the day when she can move from her rented home into her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Adom Bi Keke Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary A. describes herself as hard-working, a woman who sees no challenge too great. She is 50 years old and is the leader of the “Adom bi keke” borrower group, translated as “Just by Grace”. Mary is a manufacturer of local soap popularly known as ‘Azuma blow’ because it looks like the blow of the renowned Ghanaian boxer named Azuma Nelson. 

The soap is prepared by combining materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil and hardener to obtain the soap. The soap can be used for bathing, washing and the like. It is relatively very affordable and much patronized in the rural communities. Mary has operated her business for the past twenty years and is excited to be taking out this loan, with which she plans to purchase ingredients for soap-making.

Mary is divorced and she is the mother of six children. The other members in the group are also engaged in trades such as food-selling, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothes sales, etc. They plan to invest the loan to purchase stock in bulk to grow their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide a good education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase soap-making ingredients

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en: Carmelito M. is from the village of Tierra, Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 54 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Carmelito owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Carmelito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding his business. Carmelito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda B. is from the village of Tierra, Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has four adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a specialized retail business selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 11,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Nonime

texts.en: Nonime M. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Nonime owns and operates a specialized retail business selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Nonime joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Nonime is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, un matrimonio de agricultores que radican en el distrito de La Florida un distrito de la sierra norte de nuestro país ubicado en la provincia de San Miguel de la región Cajamarca, a mas de dos horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de comida preparada, bebidas gaseosas y licores en su domicilio, ella cuenta con un pequeño restaurante donde atiende los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes, este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres al sostenimiento de su hogar. Adicionalmente ella también ayuda a sus padres en labores propias de la agricultura.

Erlinda desea realizar mejoras en la construcción del ambiente en donde atiende a sus clientes: ella desea darle acabado a las paredes y poner piso; de esa manera su negocio tendrá mejor vista y atraerá mas clientes. Para alcanzar su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Erlinda es una mujer que desea salir adelante y ofrecerle a su hija y a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old. She is a single mother and has a 12-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents, an agricultural couple that lives in La Florida district. It is in the northern mountains of our country, located in the San Miguel province of the Cajamarca region. It is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling pre-cooked meals, soda and liquor in her home for more than a year. She has a small restaurant where she takes her customers’ orders. This business allows her to cover her personal expenses and help her parents maintain their home. In addition, she helps her parents with the farm work. Erlinda wants to make improvements to the structure where she waits on her customers. She would like to put a finish on the walls and lay a floor. This way her business would look nicer and attract more customers. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN to reach her goal. Erlinda is a woman who wants to get ahead and offer her daughter and parents a better quality of life. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area where she lives hold her in very high esteem and consider her a responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for improvements in infrastructure of the food and drink service area.

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas: Grupo 5 Group

texts.en:
Yessica is the coordinator of her group, Renovacion Las Aguilas: Grupo 5 (Renewal: The Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, in the center of the country in an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Yessica is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small ambulatory clothing-sales business. She will use the profits to expand her business and work towards establishing a small store in a fixed location. She hopes this will generate better living conditions for herself and her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, perfume, accessories, undergarments and other articles to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet M. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Juliet owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing wood planks [for resale]

loans.name: Placida

texts.en: Placida G. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Placida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Placida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Placida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones [for resale]

loans.name: Marlene Sabina

texts.es: Marlene Sabina tiene 29 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado y destace de carne. Tiene más de 5 años tener este negocio, se dedica principalmente a la crianza y venta de animales .Estas actividades le ayudan a solventar la economía familiar ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Marlene desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus animales también le gustaría mejorar la estructura de su vivienda ya que el invierno se acerca y quiere preparada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ganado ya que este negocio es muy rentable.
texts.en:
Marlene Sabina is 29 years old. Her business is the purchase and sale of livestock and butchering. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. She works mainly in raising and selling animals. These activities help her pay the family bills, since she has two young children who are in her care. Marlene wants to buy balanced feed to improve the quality of her animals. She also would like to improve the structure of her house since winter is coming and she wants to be prepared. The loan that she is applying for is to buy livestock, since this business is very profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying generic products

loans.name: Walter Antolin

texts.es:
Walter es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de La Florida, un distrito de la sierra norte del país, perteneciente a la provincia de San Miguel en la región Cajamarca, se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la fabricación de muebles y puertas para el hogar, para realizar su trabajo cuenta con un taller instalado en su domicilio; el realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos y también confecciona muebles para venderlos en diversos mercados de la zona. El negocio le viene de familia y ha sabido valerse de el para sacar adelante a los suyos. Como es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta actualmente, trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio.

Walter desea renovar la hoja de sierra de su máquina cortadora, ya que la que tiene actualmente ha perdido potencia y no realiza un buen trabajo; además desea adquirir mas madera para realizar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes por entregar. Para realizar sus planes ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Walter es un padre que trabaja incansablemente para lograr el bienestar de su familia. El desea seguir creciendo como empresario para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida, además desea brindar una buena educación a sus hijos. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Walter is 50 years old and is the father of a family. He lives with his wife and two children in the district of La Florida, a district in the northern mountains of the country; it belongs to the San Miguel province of the Cajamarca region. It is located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked for more than five years making furniture and doors for the home. To do his work, he relies on a workshop set up in his home. He does work based on orders and also makes furniture to sell at the various markets in the region. The business came to him from his family, and he has known how to manage it to pass it on to his own. As it is the only source of income that he counts on now, he tries to do his best to keep up the business. Walter wants to replace the blade of his cutting machine, since the one that he has now has lost power and doesn't do good work. He also wants to acquire more wood to fill some orders which are waiting to be filled. To carry out his plans, he has applied for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 PEN. Walter is a father who works untiringly for the well-being of his family. He wants to continue growing as a businessman to obtain better earnings and improve their quality of life. In addition, he wants to offer a good education to his children. In the neighborhood where he lives, his neighbors and clients admire him very much and consider him a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a saw blade and wood to maintain his carpentry shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: G.s Las Mojarras Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Las Mojarras está conformado por Saúl Jacinto y Carla Modesta ambos tienen las misma actividad económica que es la compra de cerdos. Carla tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse a este negocio pues siempre está preocupada por mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia, ella comenzó vendiendo leña, mas tarde por iniciativa propia decide comprar cerdos para engordarlos y observo que tenía muy buenos resultados con la ayuda de Carla fue que ayudo a Saúl decide también ingresar en este negocio así ambos se ha unido con el mismo fin. El destino del crédito es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para engordarlos. Sueñan con que sus hijos puedan ingresar a una universidad para tener la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
The group, “Las Mojarras” includes Saúl, and Carla. Both have the same type of business; raising hogs. Carla has been doing this for more than 12 years and is constantly concerned with improving her economic status and that of her family. She began selling firewood and later decided to buy hogs to fatten them up. She noticed that she was getting good results, so she also helped Saúl become involved in the same business and they work together toward the same goal. They will use the money from this loan to buy more hogs and feed. They both hope that their children will be able to attend university.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pagnes

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Pierrette vit à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis cinq ans. Pierrette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Pour y arriver, Pierrette vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, igname, etc.), à son domicile. Pierrette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pierrette exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pierrette a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Pierrette sollicite à nouveau un prêt, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître sa clientèle, pour se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Pierrette A. is married and the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school, of whom two are under her care. She has been living in Agblangandan, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for the past five years. She lives alone with her children and is their sole support. To make ends meet, Pierrette sells a variety of produce (corn, beans, cassava flour, yams, etc.) from her home. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Pierrette has been running this business for five years and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she duly reimbursed. She is now requesting another loan, to increase her stock supply as well as her customer base, and make more profit.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, beans, rice, and yams

loans.name: Ahontefoo Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Seth is a 38-year-old man who describes himself as loyal.  He is the leader of a group called 'Ahontefoo', which means “Righteous” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  Seth has been a grocery trader for the past 7 years.  He will use the loan to buy provisions for his shop.  Seth hopes to become one of the best-known grocery sellers in the area. 
 
Seth is married and has 5 children between 1 ½ and 14 years old.  He hopes to provide his children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to replenish inventory

loans.name: Alabanza De Dios Grupo 1, Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Charles plans to use this loan to invest in his small variety products store by moving it to a location better for his sales – the central market. His group is located in Santiago, the center of the country. It is an area known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure, typical of the area.

Charles is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to improve living conditions for himself and his family. He thanks you all for your support. 

Charles is the coordinator of his group" Alabanza de Dios" (Blessing of God, Groups 1, 2) and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, undergarments, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Florida, un distrito de la sierra norte del país, pertenece a la provincia de San Miguel de la región Cajamarca. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.	

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la fabricación de muebles y puertas. Para realizar su trabajo cuenta con un taller instalado en su domicilio. Allí el confecciona sus productos en base a pedidos y también fabrica muebles por su cuenta para venderlos en los principales mercados de la zona. El negocio le viene de familia, ya que su hermano también se dedica a esta labor y ambos se valen de esta actividad para salir adelante.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la fabricación de mas muebles por cuenta propia, de modo que pueda colocar mas productos en los mercados y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de madera.

José es un padre bastante reponsable y que se vale de su labor para sacar a los suyos adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona es conocido por su honradez y entrega a su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in the La Florida district, a district located in the northern mountain range of the country. It is part of the San Miguel province in the Cajamarca region, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has been manufacturing doors and furniture for ten years and has a shop in his home where he does his work. It is there where he manufactures furniture to order and also makes some on his own, so that he can sell it at the main markets within his zone. This is a family business and his brother also works this trade. Together they work to get ahead. José would like to expand his business and make more furniture in order to have more to sell in the markets and increase his income. He has requested this loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) through Edpyme Alternativa in order to help reach his goal. He will use the money to buy lumber. José is a very responsible father who works hard to help his children get ahead. His greatest desire is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur in order to improve his family’s quality of life. He is known in his zone for his honesty and ability to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Née en 1951 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Z. Thérèse est mariée à DENON Timothée et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Thérèse vit depuis quinze ans environs au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, avec sa famille. Thérèse vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Thérèse vend divers condiments (piment, poivre, ails, crevettes écrasés, bicarbonate, conserves de tomates, huile de palme, etc.) au marché de Avotrou. Thérèse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Thérèse exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans, et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter davantage son stock de produits et de se faire plus de profits grâce aux ventes qu’elle réalisera, Thérèse sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1951 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Thérèse Z. is married to Timothée DENON and is the mother of four children, of whom some attend (or have attended) school. Thérèse has been living for the past 15 years in the Avotrou borough of Cotonou, with her family. She helps her husband deal with the various family expenses, thanks to the income her activity generates. Thérèse sells various condiments (hot peppers, pepper, garlic, shrimp paste, baking soda, canned tomatoes, palm oil, etc.) at the Avotrou market. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Thérèse has been running her business for the past five years, and has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which were fully repaid. Wanting to increase her stock of products and achieve more profits with her projected sales, she is now requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various condiments (hot peppers, pepper, garlic, shrimp paste and canned tomatoes)

loans.name: G.s. Las Unidas Group

texts.es: Las tres Señoras que conforman este Grupo solidario llamado Las Unidas en Cristo. Rosario Patricia, Josefa Bernarda y Carla Patricia. La actividad económica de cada una de ellas. Carla se dedica a la venta de mariscos, frijoles cocidos y leña. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es muy variado pues a Carla se le conoce por ofrecer diferentes productos siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo, con la ayuda de sus otras compañeras. Es así que decidieron realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio pues las tres viven en condiciones muy humildes. Desean es proporcionarle mejoras a sus respectivas vivienda.
texts.en:
The three ladies who form this group, called “Las Unidas en Cristo” (United in Christ) are Rosario, Josefa, and Carla. Carla sells seafood, cooked beans, and firewood. She has been doing this for more than four years and is known for offering a variety of items. She has always enjoyed helping her three children get ahead with the aid of the other members. They have decided to ask for this loan in order to buy supplies for their businesses. They each live in humble homes and would like to improve them.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Yuliana Maribel

texts.es:
Yuliana de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, tienen dos hijos de 2 y tres meses de edad, debido a su embarazo la hermana de Yuliana le regalo algunos productos de fiesta para vender, cuando se le agotaron  y por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para tener mas ingresos, compraron cuadernos, fomix y artículos para fiestas. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital, alquilo un local para tener mas espacio para vender sus artículos de fiesta. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00pm. Vende muñecas piñatas, cuadernos, etc. Para tener mas variedad en su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, fomix y artículos para fiesta. 

En el futuro quiere  tener una línea de locales que vendan artículos para fiestas.
texts.en:
Yuliana is 29 years old and lives in suburbs of Guayaquil. They have two children; age two, and age three months. As a result of her pregnancy, her sister gave her some party supplies to sell. When they ran out, she had to invest her savings to increase her income. They bought notebooks and more party supplies. Little by little she began increasing her capital and rented a location to have more space to sell party supplies. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She sells painted dolls, notebooks, etc. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy more items in order to be able to offer a greater variety. She would eventually like to open a chain of stores selling party supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Joaquim Ricardo

texts.pt:
Joaquim Ricardo G. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 06 e 02 anos de idade, todos ainda não vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pois perdeu o pai ainda novo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane com os seus pais ainda muito novo. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 2 anos, também é construtor de casas de alvenaria. Possui um empregado que lhe auxilia nos seus trabalhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua mãe que também é clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pares de sapato para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no comércio e um dos sonhos é ter um estabelecimento comercial condigno.
texts.en:
Joaquim Ricardo G. was born in Manhiça District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are 6 and 2 years old. Neither of the children goes to school yet. Joaquim only finished eighth grade and did not continue school because of financial problems, as he lost his father while still young. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two brothers who live with him. Joaquim left Manhiça to move to Boane District with his parents when he was very young. For more than two years he has had his own shoe resale business. He also builds brick houses. He has one employee who helps him with his work, and he earns about 9,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses and still manages to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). He has never had loans from other banks. Joaquim learned about Hluvuku through his mother, who is also a customer of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 9,000 meticias to buy pairs of shoes so he can increase his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he will be able to take out more loans. In the future, he intends to ask for more loans to use in his business, and one of his dreams is to have a nice shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cola nuts and rice

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Née en 1973, H. Emilienne est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Emilienne est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants depuis un an à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Seule Emilienne assure les différentes charges familiales. Emilienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Emilienne vend des tissus et des fournitures scolaires à son domicile, ce qui l'aide à subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille. Emilienne exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de sept prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La demande de la clientèle de Emilienne devient de plus en plus forte. Afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de parvenir à satisfaire tous ses clients, Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Emilienne H. is the mother of four children, of whom some attend (or have attended) school. She is a widow who for the past year has been living with her children in Lokokoukoumè, in the Sèmè-Podji commune. She is alone to deal with the various family expenses. Emilienne has not attended school herself. For the past ten years she has retailed clothing fabric and school supplies from her home, which helps her meet her family’s needs. She is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted seven loans, all repaid in full. Emilienne’s customers are steadily increasing. She is requesting another loan to increase her stock of supplies and manage to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags and shoes

loans.name: Octavio Sansao

texts.pt:
Octávio Sansão M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 10, 08 e 04 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, mas construiu sua casa própria no mesmo bairro. É negociante ha mais de 6 anos, possui 2 empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu trabalho e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda da sua esposa que também faz seu negócio consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar roupa (camisas, calças, fardo de chinelos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no comércio e um dos sonhos é concluir a construção do seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Octavio Sansao M. was born in the city of Matola, Province of Maputo, south of Mozambique, he is 33 years old, and is married and has 3 kids who are 10, 8 and 4 years old, the oldest ones go to school. He studied until the 7th grade and couldn't finished due to lack of financial resources. He lives on his own house with his family and doesn't supports anyone else. He never left the city were he was born, and built his house on his same neighbourhood. He has been a businessman for the past 6 years, and has 2 employees who help him in his work and is able to get a profit close to 6,500mt a month that applies to his expenses with his wife's help who also has a business and they are able to save some money in a bank account (Millenium Bim). He never had loans with any banks, he learned about Hluvuku thru some neighbors who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan with the value of 10,000mt which he wants to use to buy clothes (t-shirts, shoes, packs of flip flops and others) to increase the quantities of his merchandise. He promises to pay this loan on time to be able to access new ones. In the future he pretends to request more loans to apply to his business and one of his dreams is to finish to build his store.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes (t-shirts, shoes, packs of flip flops and others)

loans.name: Shining Star Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Agartha is a 54-year-old woman who describes herself as loyal.  She is the leader of the group named 'Shining Star'.   For the past 4 years, Agartha has been a palm oil trader.  Palm oil is reddish flavorful cooking oil used frequently here in preparation of food and sauces, produced from palm nuts.  Agartha will use the loan to buy palm nuts for her trade.  

Agartha is married and has 8 children.  Her hopes include providing her children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: buying palm fruits to produce palm oil

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
Vicente Claiton Matimati nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 28 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 07 anos e 04 meses de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, é negociante e faz prestação de serviços nas bombas de combustível da Petromoc ha mais de 6 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda da sua esposa que também faz seu negócio consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 10.400.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.100.00mt, 7.700.00mt, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma míni mercearia e concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Vicente Claiton Matimati was born in the District of Boane, Province of Maputo, south of Mozambique he is 28 years old, he is married and has 2 kids who are 7 years and 4 months old respectively, the oldest goes to school. He studied until the 8th grade and couldn't finished due to the lack of financial resources. He lives on his own house with his family and supports his nephews who live with him. Never left the city where he was born, he is a businessman and works at the gas pump of Petromoc for the last 6 years. He doesn't have any employees and is able to obtain an income of 6,000mt a month which he applies to his house expenses and with the help of his wife who also works at his business is able to save some money on a bank account. He never had any loans with other banks, he learned about Hluvuku thru friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his 5th loan for 10,400mt which he wants to buy construction material (sand, stone, cement and others) to continue the construction of his house. The previous loans were for 6.100mt, 7.700mt, 15.000 and 15.000mt all the for the same activity. He promises to pay on time the loan in order to obtain new ones. In the future he will request more loans to build a small grocery store and finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1973, A. Philomène est mariée à PADONOU Euloge, un conducteur de véhicule poids lourds. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis sept ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Philomène vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les charges familiales. Philomène n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Philomène vend depuis une trentaine d'année, des escargots à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est à Houègbo à Allada, que Philomène achète ses produits. Philomène a bénéficié entre temps, de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, Philomène sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Philomène A. was born in 1973 and is married to Euloge PADONOU, a truck driver. The couple has three children, who all attend school. For seven years, the family has been living in the Dogoudo neighborhood, Atlantic Department. Philomène helps her husband and supports the family expenses with him. She never attended school. For about 30 years, Philomène has been selling snails in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, to provide for herself. She buys her supplies in Houègbo, Allada. Philomène already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and increasing her stock, Philomène is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2'400 snails

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Cecilio Efrain O., es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar con sus dos hijos menores de edad, habitan en el barrio Los Ríos, él se dedica a la agricultura de la piña desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, siendo esta su fuente de ingresos más importante del hogar.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido y que obstaculizan el día a día es la escases de agua que no abastece la zona, para sufragar este problema tienen planeado construir una pila receptora de agua que les almacene  para los días de escases, fue gracias a la reforma agraria que la familia inicio sus días en la siembra, otro de sus planes, es realizar un estudio detallado del suelo donde se siembra para realizar cambios significativos que a futuro le genere mejor producción, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos y fertilizantes que mantengan en buenas condiciones el terreno donde cosecha , esta inversión a sus tierras a futuro les traerá una mejor ganancias que permitirá llevar a cabo los planes que se ha trazado, para el bienestar de su familia.

Con  apoyo de Afodenic y los Fondos Kiva a logrado mejorar sus niveles de vida que le han permitido un progreso a su bienestar y el de toda la familia, espera se le continue apoyando para futuros proyectos que le fomenten sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cecilio Efrain O. is married. His wife and older children do the housework, and they live in the Los Rios neighbourhood. Cecilio has been a a pineapple farmer for many years, and this is the most important source of income for their household. Water scarcity in his area is one of the main problems that bothers him day to day. To solve this problem they plan to build a basin to collect water to store for shortages. Thanks to the agrarian reform, the family was able to start farming. Another plan of theirs is to perform a detailed study of the soil in order to make significant changes and achieve better production. They are requesting this loan to buy plant materials and fertilizer to keep their soil in good condition. This investment in their land will bring them better earnings and allow them to realize their plans for the welfare of their family. With the support of Afodenic and Kiva funds they will be able to improve their quality of life and well-being. They hope that this support will continue in future projects to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and plant material

loans.name: Erick José

texts.es:
El señor Erick José A., tiene la edad de 32 años, es casado y con su hijo de 9 años, habitan en el Barrio de la Esperanza, él señor trabaja como taxista desde hace 10 años, su esposa es comerciante, y con sus ingresos apoya los gastos del hogar, el pequeño goza de salud y estudia la escuela primaria.

Uno de los principales problemas que poseen los taxistas y los empleados del sector de transporte en Nicaragua es el alza de precio del combustible, sumada la crisis económica que atraviesa el país, afecta de sobremanera sus economías personales, ahora solicita un préstamo para la reparación de carrocería y pintado de su carro-taxi, el préstamo le ayudara a darle un mantenimiento más óptimo que se traducirá a un mejor servicio y como tiene clientes frecuentes y convenios de transporte  con empresas, esto se difundirá por el buen servicio que el Señor  A. brinda, tras esto la recuperación rápida de la inversión, apoyando a la economía doméstica de la familia A..
texts.en:
Erick José A. is 32, is married and has a 9 year old child. They live in the Esperanza neighbourhood. Erick has been a taxi driver for 10 years and his wife is a shopkeeper. With their earnings, they cover the household costs. Their little one is in good health and is in elementary school. The rising cost of fuel is one of the principal problems of taxi drivers and other transportation workers in Nicaragua. This, on top of the economic crisis across the country, greatly affects their finances. Erick is requesting this loan for repairs and painting for his taxi car. The loan will help him to properly maintain his car, which will translate into better service. He has regular customers and transport agreements with companies, which spreads the word about his good service. Thus, he will quickly recuperate the investment, and it will be a great help to his family's finances.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Jenny Cruz

texts.es:
Jenny de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, tiene un hijo de 15 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. Ella para poder solventar su hogar trabaja hace 6 años atrás vendiendo ropa a todos sus conocidos y amigos. La ropa ella la comprar en un almacén que venden ropa usada y las vende a un mayor valor. 

Trabaja todos los días promocionando y vendiendo la ropa a sus clientes. Vende camisetas a $ 4.00, blusas a $ 6.00 y pantalones a $ 10.00. Para que sus clientes tengas mas facilidad de comprar la ropa Jenny les vende a crédito y las pueden pagar en partes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas ropa como camisetas, blusas, pantalones. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Jenny is 48 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She has a 15 year old son who attends the public school. She has been working for the past six years, selling clothing to her friends and acquaintances, in order to help with the household expenses. She buys her merchandise from a warehouse that sells used clothing and resells it for a profit. She works every day promoting and selling to her customers. She sells t-shirts, blouses, and pants. She offers credit to her customers, so that it will be easier for them to buy from her. She will use the money from this loan to buy more clothing items, such as t-shirts, blouses, and pants. She would like to open her own clothing warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, S. Hélène est mariée à HOMEVO Mathieu, un maçon. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Dogoudo à Allada.Hélène assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Hélène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Hélène vend des tissus de façon ambulante à Allada. Hélène achète ses tissus à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais aussi à Allada. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à faire face sans grande difficulté, à ses différents besoins. Hélène a bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Hélène désire élever le niveau de son activité et accroître sa clientèle à travers ses produits. C'est pour cette raison que Hélène sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Hélène S. was born in 1982 in Allada, Atlantic Department, and is married to Mathieu HOMEVO, a mason. The couple has three children, out of whom some attend schools. The family lives in the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada. Helène and her husband both ensure that the various family expenses are covered. Helène never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling fabrics as an ambulant saleswoman in Allada. She buys her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, but also in Allada. This business creates income that helps her provide for herself without many difficulties. Helène already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. She would like to bolster her business and increase her clientele. For this reason, Helène is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Martha Agripina

texts.es:
Martha Agripina M. tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada y tiene seis hijos. Reside en Juticalpa en el Barrio Lempira y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Tres Mariposas. Hace tres años Martha comenzo vendiendo tortillas y poco a poco con el apoyo de los prestamos de FAMA a ido creciendo su negocio y ahora tiene una pulperia que funciona en una parte de su casa. Su sueño es que dentro de algun tiempo se convierta en un minisuper y que sus hijos se superen y sigan sus estudios. 

Con los prestamos anteriores comenzo a construir un muro alrededor de su casa pero no tenia suficiente fondos para terminarlo. Con el nuevo prestamo comprara malla ciclon, postes de metal, bloques y bolsas de cemento para terminar de construirlo. 

Con el muro completo Martha y su familia se sentiran mas seguros, la vivienda se vera mas bonita y sus clientes se sentiran en un ambiente mas agradable. Martha ha sido una buena clienta de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha Agripina M. is 51 years old. She is married and has six children. She lives in the Lempira neighborhood of Juticalpa and is a member of the Las Tres Mariposas [the three butterflies] solidarity group. Three years ago Martha starting selling tortillas and little by little with the support of the loans from FAMA has grown her business. She now has a small grocery store that she runs out of her house. Her dream is that soon she will be able to convert to a mini supermarket and that her children will be successful and continue their studies. With the previous loans she started to build a wall around her house but she didn't have enough money to finish it. With this new loan she will buy chicken wire, metal posts and blocks and bags of.cement to finish building the wall. When the wall is finished Martha and her family will feel much safer, their home will be more beautiful and her clients will feel that her store has a more agreeable location. Martha has been a good client of FAMA's and has always made her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken wire, metal posts and blocks and bags of concrete to build a wall..

loans.name: G.s. Salmo 91 Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario compuesto por dos personas, tienen 3 créditos y es uno de los grupos muy responsables con sus cuotas. Natividad Ivette vende  mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos, zapatos desde hace 20 años, tiene 44 años de edad y junto a su esposo se han esforzado para sacar adelante la familia, ya que es una de sus prioridades es que su hijos logren salir adelante, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio, ella vende su producto en sus comarcas. La señora Marta Lorena también vende mercadería en general, realiza la compra de sus productos en el mercado oriental donde los precios son más favorables a si ella puede ganar un poco más, además recibe ayuda de su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista en una moto taxi, juntas están solicitando un nuevo financiamiento ya que se acerca el día de las madres y ella desean aprovechar esa fecha  para realizar mejores ventas.
texts.en:
This group consists two members. They have three loans and are one of the most responsible groups when it comes to repayment. Natividad has been selling general merchandise, such as clothing, cosmetics and shoes, for the past 20 years. She is 44 years old and she and her husband have worked hard to get their family ahead. Having their children come out ahead it a top priority for them. She is asking for this loan in order to buy inventory for her business. She sells her products in her neighborhood. Marta also sells general merchandise and buys her products in the west market where she can get them for better prices. This way she can earn a little bit more. She also gets help from her husband, who works as a mototaxi driver. Together, these ladies are asking for a new loan, now that mothers' day is approaching and they want to take advantage of this day and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr: A. Madina est née le 15 Janvier 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Madina vit depuis près de vingt et un ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Madina est mariée à HOUNTON Mathias, un enseignant. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Madina vit enssemble avec son mari et son enfant. Madina supporte avec son mari, les différentes charges de la famille. Madina a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a juste un an que Madina a commencé la vente de divers produits (savons, conserves de tomate et de sardines, pâtes alimentaires, lait, alumettes, bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique à Allada. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Madina achète ses produits. Madina a bénéficié une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Madina désire rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Madina sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Madina A. was born on January 15, 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for almost 21 years in the Dogoudo district of Allada, in the Atlantic Prefecture. She is married to Mathias Hounton, a teacher. They have a child who does not yet go to school. Madina lives together with her husband. Madina and her husband jointly take care of the family budget. Madina finished only secondary school. Just about a year ago, she started selling various items (soaps, canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, milk, matches, candles etc) in her store in Allada. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Madina already had one previous loan from ALIDé loan and repaid it properly. She would like to expand the scope of her activity somewhat and to be able to better meet customer demand. This is why she is seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 3 bags of rice, cartons of pasta, oil, soaps etc

loans.name: Johana Antonia

texts.es: Johana Antonia tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado y a camiones repartidores, sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El crédito lo ofrece solo a clientes que ya tienen tiempo de trabajar con ella,  así aumentan sus números de clientes en su pulpería. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y si es posible tener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Johana runs a general store from her home. She buys her merchandise in cash from delivery trucks. Her sales are cash and credit. She has always struggled to improve her family’s quality of life. She offers credit to established customers, allowing her to increase her clientele. She is requesting this loan in order to invest into her business; to make it more productive. She would eventually like to expand her business and perhaps create a second source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing shoes [for resale]

loans.name: Adanyossi

texts.fr: T. Adanyossi est née en 1972 et est mariée à AYIDOHOME Lambert, un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de douze ans que Adanyossi s'est installée au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Adanyossi réside en effet avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Adanyossi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis trente ans, Adanyossi mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile et aussi au marché de Allada. Adanyossi s'approvisionne à Agonmey et à Allada au Bénin. Adanyossi avait obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Adanyossi sollicite un troisième prêt afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus d'économie.
texts.en:
Adanyossi T. was born in 1972 and is married to Lambert AYIDOHOME, a driver. The couple has two children, both in school. Nearly twelve years ago Adanyossi moved to the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada, in the Atlantic department. Adanyossi lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the different family responsibilities. Adanyossi did not attend school. For thirty years, Adanyossi has run a business selling charcoal from home and also at the Allada market. Adanyossi buys her supplies in Agonmey and Allada in Benin. Adanyossi had obtained two loans that were all repaid. In response to increasing demand from her clientele, Adanyossi is requesting a third loan to improve her business and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 17 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 57 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajo muy duro para sobresalir, vive en su casa propia con sus dos menores hijas y lo que más desea es brindarles un mejor futuro. Los sembríos de Elsa son los mejores cuidados del poblado de Caritá, ya que ella los cuida y trabaja con mucha paciencia y cariño, es por ello que obtiene una buena producción, del cual son llevados a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios ofrece, resultándole rentable el negocio.  Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, puesto que debe utilizar productos químicos que afectan su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, asimismo comprar abono e insecticidas para mejorar la productividad de su chacra.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 57, is a woman who has worked very hard throughout her life to get ahead. She lives in her own house with her two younger daughters, and her greatest desire is to provide them with a better future. Elsa's fields are the best-kept of the village of Caritá, since she takes good care of them and works with great patience and dedication. Because of this, she obtains good harvests, which are taken to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma for sale, since better prices are offered there, making the business profitable. She has worked in this area for 30 years, and what she likes best about her work is planting her crops; what she considers most difficult is fumigating her fields, since she has to use chemical products which affect her health. Over time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production. This is her sixth loan with MFP; she has always been very punctual in making her payments, and she plans to continue in this manner. In her communal bank, she is known as a very cheerful and responsible person. With the two thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will buy pea seeds to plant, as well as fertilizer and insecticides to improve the productivity of her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pea seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Brunilda del Carmen C. M., es un adulto mayor de 63 años habitante de Pilas Orientales, se dedican a la agricultura, tienen 10 hijos casados e independientes, tiene un ato y pretenden a futuro mejorar el corral, ha sido casi una vida de dedicarse a este rubro que ha alimentado  a sus hijos todos estos años.

Ellos se dedican a la siembra de plátanos y planean diversificar sus siembras pero para esto solicitan un  préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes y pesticidas e insumos vegetativos que salvaguarden el buen crecimiento de los nuevos cultivos, tras esto las buenas utilidades generadas por un aumento en la producción, les permitirá mejores condiciones de vida que favorezcan todos sus hijos puesto que desean heredarles sus terrenos. Ha sido gracias a los fondos de Kiva y Afodenic que han progresado sus condiciones de vida por el apoyo a nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brunilda del Carmen C. M., is a 63-year old lady from Pilas Orientales. She works in farming, and has 10 married and independent children. She keeps animals and in the future plans to improve the corral. She has spent almost her whole life working in this area and the farming has fed her sons and daughters all these years. She grows plantains and plans on diversifying her crops. However with this loan that she is requesting now, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides, and plant food that will safeguard the healthy growth of her new seedlings. The good earnings generated by the increase in production will allow her to improve the living conditions that will help all her children, since they want to inherit the land. She has gotten ahead thanks to the funds from Kiva and Afodenic which have enabled her to support new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn and other products

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Emilio A. M., tienen 24 años es soltero, agricultor, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en este lugar existen varios productores de diferentes  siembras, él  a su corta edad es muy trabajador y apoya económicamente a su familia, dentro de los problemas que más lo ha agobiado es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a la zona en donde habita, el proviene de una familia muy humilde, que con mucho esfuerzo logro culminar sus estudios secundarios.

Cosecha piña, y tiene una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro y fue gracias a la reforma agraria y el apoyo de sus padres que comenzaron sus días de agricultor, solicita un préstamo para la inversión en la compra de materiales agrícolas que mejoren y salvaguarden el crecimiento de la producción para nuevos cultivos que favorezcan las ventas y los ingresos del Sr. A.. Tras esto mejoraran sus condiciones de vida y obtener los recursos económicos para compra un terreno y edificar su viviendo con el propósito de formar familia pronto.
texts.en:
Señor Pablo Emilio A. M. is 24 years old and is single. He is a farmer and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. In this area there are several farmers who produce a variety of crops. At his young age, he is very hardworking and supports his family economically. Among the problems that have most oppressed him is the lack of potable water, which is not supplied in the zone where he lives. He comes from a very humble family, and with much effort he succeeded in completing his secondary studies. He harvests pineapple and has ten years of experience in this type of work. It was thanks to the agrarian reform and the support of his parents that he began his days as a farmer. He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural materials that will improve and protect the growth of new crops that will help his sales and income. Through this his living conditions will improve and he will obtain the resources necessary to buy a plot of land and build a home with the intention of forming a family soon.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy agricultural materials to provide appropriate care for his crops

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha Isabel tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella en esta ocasión ella necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima mantequilla, queso, huevo harina en grandes cantidades pues necesario para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El sueño de Martha es mantener el negocio, pues es muy importante mejorar sus condiciones que son necesarias de su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and makes and sells confectionary items. She has been doing this for five years and has always enjoyed her work. She needs this loan in order to buy ingredients such as butter, cheese, eggs, and flour in bulk. Martha dreams of maintaining her business and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “God Help” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K., pictured on the left. Kadiatu is age 45 and was born in Binkolo village about seven miles away from Makeni. She is married with six children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending secondary school, three are in primary school and two are already grown-ups and living on their own.  For more than ten years now, Kadiatu has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), beans, salt, firewood, etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned goods in large quantity to add to her current ones. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy palm oil, beans, salt, firewood, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Mary K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Kamakwe town in northern Sierra Leone, about 26 years ago. Mary is single and has one child who is still a baby. Mary sells rice, sugar and 'gari' (quick-cooking food made out of cassava roots).  She has been doing this business for three years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, sugar and 'gari' wholesale. 

In the picture are members of the 'Mary's group' and loan officer Daniel Banya, handing over the loan.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and 'gari' wholesale

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 22 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo William de 24 años y sus 2 hijos Yesira de 3 y Jeferson de 6 meses,  quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Karina en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma le es muy difícil y pesado. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Karina, who is 22 years old, is a very happy and hardworking mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband William, who is 24, and their two children, Yesira, who is 3, and Jeferson, who is 6 months old. They are the principal motivation for all her efforts. The long days of work that Karina puts in on her land have made her very knowledgeable about agriculture. Her crops are well cared for, and she always obtains a good price from the sale of her products. She has been doing this work for 5 years, and what she likes best about her work is cultivating the land, since it is an activity that she has carried out since she was a girl. Nevertheless, the need to transport her products to the market at Tarma is very difficult and wearisome for her. In time, she hopes to buy more land and thus increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is saving to make the payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, where she feels very happy. With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy fertilizer and insecticides to care for her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Miguel Estanislado

texts.es:
