El señor Miguel Estanislado A. V., es un hombre adulto de 55 años soltero, pero padre de familia de 3 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y viven de forma independiente, él es agricultor de piña hawaiana,   y tiene una experiencia de más de 31 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Dos  de los problemas que más afecta sus sembrados es el robo y la infección de las plagas que a ocasionado disminución en la producción, produciendo un problema económico que aflige a su economía personal o en la inversión de otras fuentes de ingreso, es para este fin que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales fungicidas que garanticen las buenas siembras, un excelente mantenimiento permitirá el capital necesario para el mejoramiento continuo de su nivel de vida o los recursos necesarios para la incursión hacia nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Estanislado A. V. is a adult of 55. He is single but is the father of three adult children who live and work independently. He grows Hawaiian pineapple and has more than 31 years of experience in working at this activity. Two of the problems that most affect his fields are theft and infections of scourges that have caused decreases in production, creating an economic problem that affects his personal finances or his investments in other sources of income. It is for this reason that he is applying for a loan to purchase fungicides that will guarantee good crops. Excellent maintenance will provide the capital necessary for the continual improvement of his standard of living or the resources necessary to establish new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fungicides that guarantee a good crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm oil

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florencio de 55 años y sus 2 queridas hijas, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Yolanda junto a su esposo en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de papas y alverja, siendo estos productos de mejor calidad y que pueden ofrecer para el consumo diario. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectar sus cultivos. Con el tiempo desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su grupo comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y alverja, para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a loving and happy 45 year-old mother. She is a homeowner and lives with her 55 year-old husband, Florencio, and her 2 beloved daughters whom she wishes to provide for a brighter future. Yolanda and her husband work hard in their vegetable garden to keep their crops well maintained, and therefore the products are bought quickly on the days they are sold. Their main source of income is the sale of potatoes and peas. These are the highest quality crops they can offer for daily consumption. Yolanda feels her work is paying off when she harvests her land, as such, this is her favorite part of the job. She has been doing this work for 30 years and considers the most difficult task is to be preventing her crops from being damage by pests. Eventually, she plans to buy more land to expand her crops. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She always pays on time and has never had any issues with her lending group, where she is in charge of adding the share of joy that keeps the other members happy. Yolanda is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy potato and pea seeds to plant this season.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato and pea seeds

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
La señora Estelvina tiene la edad de 49 años es casada y con sus esposo y sus 4 hijos habitan en el barrio San Ignacio, este es un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe, sus habitantes son personas muy humildes que no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para emprenderse por sí solos, es por esta razón solicitan un apoyo de los bancos o financieras para crear nuevas fuentes de ingresos, en su mayoría son familias que se dedican a la agricultura. La familia de la señora Estelivina tiene más de 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad, especialmente en la siembra de la piña hawaiana.

Uno de los principales problemas que le amenazan sus cosechas son los gases que emana un volcán que se encuentra a las cercanías de sus siembras estos gases ácidos, dañan sus cosechas, es por esta razón que espera a futuro tener los recursos económicos, para realizar un estudio de conservación del suelo, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que consientan un mejor  mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Esta inversión garantizará un buen manejo y le permitirá  a futuro mejores condiciones económicas para la incursión de nuevos mercados que le apoyen a  su progreso diario.
texts.en:
Estelvina is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children. They live in the San Ignacio neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe, where the residents are very humble people who do not have the necessary resources to set up a business by themselves. This is why they ask for support from banks or other financial institutions, so they can create new sources of income. The majority of these families work in agriculture. Ms. Estelvina's family has more than 12 years of experience in this activity, especially in the cultivation of Hawaiian pineapples. One of the biggest threats to Estelvina's crops are gases emitted by a volcano near her fields. These acidic gases damage her crops, and this is why she hopes that in the future she will have the economic resources to study soil conservation. For now, she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to help her better maintain her crops. This investment will guarantee good management of her crops. It will allow her to improve her economic situation in the future by enabling her to enter new markets, which will support her daily progress.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to help her better maintain her crops.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esta pequeña pulpería nace con la idea de buscar una forma de generar ingresos a su familia  pero como no tenía mucho dinero decidió buscar la forma en cómo invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos a los vecinos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar y aceite. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda, pues necesario para mantener a sus clientes. El sueño de Maria es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and has been running a general store for more than five years. She began her small business in order to be able to generate some income for her family. She didn't have much money, so she needed a way to invest her money into food products that she could sell to her neighbors. Little by little she improved her store. She continues to work at it, even though she does not have many items. She sells rice, sugar, and cooking oil. She will use the money from this loan to buy more food items for her store, in order to be able to keep her customers. Maria hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marie-Josée

texts.fr: H. Marie-Josée est née le 1er mars 1963 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Marie-Josée vit avec son mari ADJAGBA Philippe, un brodeur. Marie-Josée à trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à la charge du couple. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Marie-Josée a fait les cours primaires. Depuis sept ans, Marie-Josée mène comme activité, la vente de viande d'agoutit à Allada, ce qui lui permet d'apporter une aide  à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Marie-Josée s'approvisionne à Houègbo au Bénin. Marie-José avait bénéficié d'un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but d'accroitre son capital et d'augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marie Josée sollicite un second prêt auprès de ALIDé. Marie-Josée envisage plus tard acquérir une parcelle et construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Marie-Josee H. was born on 1 March 1963 in Allada in the Atlantique Province. Marie-Josee lives with her husband Philip ADJAGBA, an embroiderer. Marie-Josee has three children who have attended school, two of which are at home. The couple works together to meet the needs of the family. Marie-Josee finished elementary school. For seven years, Marie-Josée has been selling agoutis meat in Allada, which allows her to help her husband meet the family needs. Marie-Josee gets her product at Houègbo in Benin. Marie-Jose got a first loan from ALIDé and it was fully repaid. Marie Josee is seeking a second loan from ALIDé to increase her capital and increase her inventory to better meet customer demand. In the future, Marie-Josee plans to acquire a plot of land and build a house.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the meat of 8 agoutis

loans.name: Pedro Javier

texts.es: Pedro Javier tiene 33 años, es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de carpintería, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, Anteriormente el señor no tenía un trabajo como todo padre responsable de 3 hijos a su cargo, tenía que buscar la manera de obtener un rubro que le generara ingresos, por lo que decide aprender este oficio y empezar a ganar lo necesario para solventar los gastos del hogar. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de herramientas, madera, pega, clavos entre otras cosas necesarias. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 33 years old. He likes his work very much and is very responsible. He has been a carpenter for more than 20 years. He used to be unemployed, but like any responsible father with three children, he needed a way to generate income, so he decided to learn this trade. He is asking for this loan in order to buy tools, lumber, glue, nails, and other supplies. He wants to be able to grow his business and improve the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: T. Josephine est née en 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josephine vit depuis trente cinq ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à AHOUANSE Vital, Josephine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Josephine a trois autres enfants à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Josephine vit seule avec ses enfants. Depuis près de vingt ans, Josephine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) à Allada ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Josephine vend des glacières. Josephine s'approvisionne à Allada et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Josephine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Josephine avait bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Josephine T. was born in 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For the past 35 years she has lived in the Dogoudo borough of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. Married to Vital AHOUANSE, Josephine is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. She also cares for three other children, in addition to her own, and lives alone with her children. For over 20 years Josephine has prepared and sold food in Allada (rice accompanied by sauce), which enables her to meet her own needs and those of her children. As a side business, Josephine sells iceboxes. She gets her supplies from Allada and also from Cotonou. This is the second time Josephine requests the financial support of ALIDé, to increase her activity level and improve customer satisfaction. Her first loan was repaid in full.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one bag of rice, sauce condiments and three dozen iceboxes

loans.name: Midonia Haida

texts.es: Midonia Haida tiene 57 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que fue producto de la gran necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso que ayudar a su familia, poco a poco es que se negocio fue creciendo, la ubicación de su actividad es en mercado en donde circulan mucho clientes por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener una gran carisma, ella le dedica esfuerzo y muchas horas de trabajo a este rubro. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar leche, crema, queso, cuajada, leche agria entre otros productos, para el futuro le gustaría proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Midonia Haida is 57 years old. Her business is selling dairy products. She has had this business for more than 30 years. She started it out of the necessity of earning an income to help her family. The business has grown little by little. It is located in the market, where many customers pass through, which is why she has always been very charismatic. She puts in a lot of effort and many hours of work in this business. She is requesting the loan for working capital to buy milk, cream, cheese, soft cheese, and fermented milk [similar to yoghurt], among other products. In the future, she would like to improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, cream, cheese, soft cheese, and fermented milk [similar to yoghurt]

loans.name: Yelba Merari

texts.es: En el barrio reparto David Antonio, vive Yelba Merari 25 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años su Madre inició este negocio fue aquí donde trabajaba e inició vendiendo productos como calzado y ropa, pero debido problemas de salud decide dejárselo a Yelba quien con todo su empeño y mucha disciplina ha podido solventar sus necesidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a su tercer crédito con la Fundación con él comprará calzado, pantalones, camisas, sabanas, toallas, bolsos y cosméticos pues se acerca la festividad del día de la Madre y ya tiene bastante pedidos. Por ahora sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yelba Merari is 25 years old and lives in the neighborhood subdivision called David Antonio. Three years ago, her mother started a business and Yelba began working with her selling products such as shoes and clothing. However, her mother experienced health problems and decided to leave the business to Yelba so that she could do all the work since she has the discipline to meet their needs.

At the moment, Yelba is applying for her third loan with Fundación Leon in order to buy shoes, trousers, shirts, bed sheets, towels, handbags, and cosmetics for Mother’s Day and to fulfill her existing orders. For now, she dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy shoes, trousers, shirts, bed sheets, towels, handbags, and cosmetics

loans.name: Al-Harrkan Primary School, Kabala Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the AL-Harrkan primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Established in September 1999, the school has 16 paid teachers, 8 community supported teachers, and 513 pupils. Twelve of these teachers have applied for a loan of SLL 10,700,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. This will be the first loan this group of teachers will be accessing a loan from Kiva lenders. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Lansana S. (pictured back row on the left)  is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group. The 51-year-old is married with twelve children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Lansana has been a teacher for over thirty years. With his share of this loan, he will pay school fees for his children and buy house equipment/furniture. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer, Mary Conteh, who is pictured second row left.)

loans.use: pay school fees for his children and buy furniture

loans.name: Zenelia Elvira

texts.es: Zenelia Elvira tiene 46 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Zenelia tiene más de 10 años estar en este negocio, pues ella poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en esta actividad que ha sido una de sus más grandes fuentes de ingresos para su familia, ya que disfruta mucho de hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de electrodomésticos, sabanas, toallas y bolsos. Ella desea aumentar sus ventas para mejorar la vida escolar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zenelia Elvira is 46 years old. She sells general merchandise and has more than ten years of experience in this business. Zenelia has been gradually investing in this activity which has become one of the greatest sources of income for her family. She enjoys talking with her customers.

This loan will be used to buy appliances, linens, towels, and bags. She wants to increase her sales and improve her children’s academic life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances, linens, towels, and bags

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es: Maritza Elena tiene 55 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos.  Su actividad económica es la venta de comida, por lo que llegan muchos clientes a disfrutar sus deliciosos platillos, que son muy deliciosos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella lucha todos los días por salir adelante con su negocio, por lo que es muy admirable a su edad pues tiene muchas energías. Solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para granos básicos, jugos, verduras y frutas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 55 years old. This is not the first time she has received a loan. She makes a living by selling food and has many customers who enjoy her delicious dishes. Maritza has been doing this for more than 20 years and struggles every day to get ahead in her business. It is admirable that she possesses tremendous amounts of energy at her age. Maritza is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy basic grains, juices, vegetables, and fruits. She dreams of expanding her business and improving the quality of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, juices, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Anita Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Anita Esmeralda tiene la actividad económica de venta de cosméticos. Por lo que se siente muy contenta con este financiamiento por ser la primera oportunidad que tiene de mejorar la condición de su negocio. Ella se dedico a esta actividad por el motivo de que su madre es soltera y no tenia los recursos para mantenerla a ella y su hermano, fue así que tomo valor de trabajar por su cuenta para salir adelante y ayudar a su mama. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, colonias, cremas y tratamientos entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle a sus Mama todo lo necesario para que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Sra. Anita Esmeralda sells cosmetics. She is very happy about this loan because it is her first opportunity to improve the condition of her business. Anita started her business because her mother is single and did not have the resources to support her and her brother. She finds value in working because it allow her to get ahead and help her mother.

This loan will be used to buy lipsticks, nail polishes, colognes, crèmes, treatments, and other products. She dreams of providing her mother with all the necessities so that she lacks nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona es una Madre de familia que tiene 31 años y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace más de 6 años a la venta de ropa, adicionalmente ofrece su mercadería en todos los mercados, pues no importan las distancias que tiene que recorrer, con tal de ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que ella no la pudo tener.  Desea ampliar su negocio para captar más clientes y así poder percibir más ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima en su negocio.
texts.en:
Petrona is a 31 year old mother who lives with her husband and her son who is dependent on her. She has been selling clothes for more than six years. Petrona offers her merchandise at all of the markets because it makes no difference to her how far she has to travel as long as she can give her son the opportunity to study, something that she did not have. She wants to expand her business by attracting more customers so that she can generate better revenues to get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Carlos Bionis

texts.es:
Para Carlos F.  la fabricación de escritorios, mesas para  reuniones juegos de sala, y todo lo relacionado con la madera, es la manera en que genera  ingresos para sostener a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge   y sus 3 hijos  en las edades de 10, 11 y 13 años.  Desde el año 2007  vincularse al programa de crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  le han representado incrementar su capital de trabajo, porque a través de él ha recibido tres créditos y con este último  por valor de $ 2.000.000 COP,   comprará al por mayor y de contado, madera pegante, pintura, clavos y lacas para su negocio. Cuando Carlos inició en el año 2002, le significaron muchos esfuerzos adaptarse a ser independiente, porque antes era empleado de oficios varios en el sector de la construcción, pero ahora ese es su diario vivir con autonomia y  se ha fijado su propio horario de trabajo  de 7: 30 A.M.  a 12:00 M  y de 2:00  a 6:00  P.M. y desde los lunes hasta los  sábados, y como sus clientes conocen su cultura de trabajo y tiene muy  poca competencia en el sector,  registra en su mercado un importante número de ellos.
Carlos tiene un sueño y es el de venderle a cadenas de almacenes y usar la tecnología para hacer mercadeo electrónico, pero tambien tien  un gran desafío personal y es el de ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales trabajando en  empresas multinacionales. Ellos ahora Viven cerca de supermercados y al escenario de futbol mas importante de Barranquilla : “El estadio Metropolitano” donde se divierten en familia.
texts.en:
Carlos F. has a wife and three children (ages 10, 11, and 13). He generates income to support his family by making desks, tables for parlor games, and everything else made of wood. Since 2007, Carlos has participated in the credit program with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it has helped to increase his working capital. He has received three loans, with the current one valued at 2,000,000 COP to be used for buying supplies in bulk such as wood, glue, paint, nails, and varnish for his business. When Carlos started his business in 2002, he had worked very hard to become independent. He previously held different jobs in the construction sector, but he now makes his daily living with autonomy and works a fixed schedule from 7:30am to 12pm and from 2pm to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. Carlos has a significant number of customers because they are familiar with his work ethic and there is very little competition in this sector.

Carlos dreams of selling his products through chain stores and utilizing technology for online marketing. His greatest personal challenge is seeing his children become professionals who work for multinational companies. He and his family live near the supermarkets and the largest soccer field in Barranquilla, the Metropolitan Stadium, where they go to have fun.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, glue, paint, nails, and varnish

loans.name: Vilu Maribeth

texts.es: Vilu Maribeth tiene 32 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y la venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, Vilu siempre está pensando en su hijo y en proporcionarle un ingreso que le ayude para el futuro. Pues ella trabaja todos los días algunas veces su esposo queda a cargo de la pulpería pues la venta de ropa las realiza en un tramo en el mercado, siempre está pensando la manera de incrementar  su negocio. Para un futuro le gustaría poder tener una buena estabilidad económica. El crédito que solicita es para materia prima invertida en su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilu Maribeth is 32 years old. She manages a grocery store and also sells clothing. Vilu has been in business for more than six years. She is always thinking about her son and earning an income that will help provide for his future. Vilu works every day, but sometimes her husband will look after the store while she sells clothes from a mobile cart at the market. She is always thinking about ways to increase her business. In the future, she would like to be in a financial situation that is more stable.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
